She also keeps cattle, selling the milk to mobile distributors. In addition, she raises guinea pigs and chickens. She tells us that she has been a member of the communal bank since its beginnings, that is, for the past 15 years. The loans have been beneficial for her business of buying and selling animals. With the new loan, she will buy chickens, guinea pigs and feed for her animals, as well as seeds for corn, beans, peas and other crops. Her goal is to continue working as long as her health permits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying guinea pigs, chickens, animal feed, and seeds for corn, beans, peas, etc.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is a single mother of six children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Immaculate owns a bar in Nakulabye, one of the city suburbs, and sells all types of beer and local gin. She wants to use this loan of 600,000/= to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.  She doesn't incur any transport costs as she buys from her home. Immaculate has been in this business for 10 years. Besides this bar business, she doesn’t have any other side job. Immaculate works from her home and so doesn’t pay rent though she pays for an operating license. She sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale. Her major customers are mainly older men and women. Immaculate works seven days a week. Her business challenges include the rainy season and defaulters. She aspires to build a house to accommodate her bar.  She joined MCDT because she wanted timely loans.  Immaculate resides in and owns a four-room house.  The family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beer and local gin

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea T. (pictured with her young son), 45, and her husband, Mr. Vun Torn, 46, have been married since 1986. They have six children: one son and five daughters. One weaves silk at home, three attend school, one stays at home and the last is very young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River. 

Sophea has been a silk weaver since she was seventeen years old.  She learned the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a farmer that grows rice and vegetables. Besides the farming business, Sophea and her husband raise a horse and a cow.  She is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and build a shelter for the animals.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and build a shelter for her animals.

loans.name: Kossa

texts.fr:
Kossa G. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAKIDIOTO et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle vend des légumes et condiments au marché de Tanaff. Il lui arrive, avec son plateaux chargé de quelle marchandises de faire du porte-à-porte pour vendre. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de sept ans. Les recettes qu'elle en tire lui permettent de contribuer à l'éducation des enfants.		
		
Avec elle souhaite renforcer le capital de son commerce qu'elle gère depuis qu'elle est membre de CAURIE-MF. Elle souhaiterait réaliser plus de revenus afin de pouvoir de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kossa G. is a 47 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 8 children, for whom she is responsible. She is a member of the "Banc Villageois" of BAKIDIOTO and has been granted loans 15 times in a row. She sells vegetables and condiments on the Tanaff market. From time to time, she goes selling from door to door with a tray loaded with goods. She gets her supplies from weekly markets. She has been in this trade for over seven years and the revenue generated allows her to contribute to her children's education. With this loan, she intends to strengthen the capital of her business, which she has been running since she has become a member of CAURIE-MF. She hopes to make more profits in order to better meet her children's needs.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her level of self-financing

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio es casado tiene tres hijos vive en la casa de su padre en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Silvio trabaja como maestro albañil siendo esto su único ingreso ya que la esposa se dedica a cuidar a los hijos.
El crédito solicitado es para la operación de su padre ya que tuvo un accidente.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio is married, has three children, and lives in his parent’s house in the area of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. Mr. Silvio works as a bricklaying teacher. This is his family’s only income because his wife works by taking care of the children. The requested loan is for a medical operation for his father because he had an accident. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan, and the socio-economic analysis qualifies him favorably for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment for a medical operation for his father, who suffered an accident

loans.name: German

texts.en:
German A. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 26 years old, married, and has 2 infant-age children. To earn a living, German owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. His primary source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. German has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and he earns approximately 20,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, German joined ASKI to gain access to financial services so that he can be better able to engage in business activities and improve his standard of living. Notably, German already successfully repaid a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP ($200) from ASKI. This prior loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. German is now requesting another loan, also in the amount of 9,000 PHP, which would be used to purchase fertilizers (e.g., manure). He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Pedro Giancarlo

texts.es: Pedro tiene 23 años  de edad, es soltero vive  aun con sus padres en el Caserio de Garganto, en casa de material noble de un piso. El se dedica a prestar servcio de transporte en vehiculo en condicion de alquiler venta. Tambien se dedica como mecanico. El es un joven muy activo con muchas metas y objetivos. Con el dinero que solicita sera para terminar de cancelar el vehiculo que es un automovil tico.
texts.en:
Pedro, 23, is single and still lives with his parents in Garganto in a one-storey house built of substantial materials. He provides public transportation services and also is an auto mechanic. He is a very active young man who has many goals and objectives. He will use the requested funds to pay off his vehicle which is a TIco brand car.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish paying off his car.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
Christine K.  est une femme de 34 ans, née à Gasabo, province de la Ville de Kigali capital du Rwanda. Elle est mariée et a un seul enfant qui a  3 ans. Christine et  sa famille habite à Kinyinya- Gasabo- Kigali, son niveau d’éducation est secondaire dans l’option de Biochimie. Elle est salariée dans une Eglise de PENTECOTE(ADEPR), Paroisse de Gasave ou elle est secrétaire de Révérend Pasteur de cette Eglise.
Le crédit contracté avec ACB est  le onzième, les précédents lui ont aidé d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et le présent prêt c’est pour amener l’eau dans sa maison. Ses épargnes lui permettent  de payer le loyer ou elle habite avec sa famille jusqu'à avoir sa maison laquelle elle veut installer les tuyaux d’eau.
Dans l’avenir, elle compte abandonner le secteur des salariés pour embrasser le commerce, bien sur, elle va commencer par un nouveau prêt et les épargnes antérieurs pour stabiliser sa capacité financière
texts.en:
Christine K. is 34 years old and was born in Gasabo, in the Province of the Town of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. She is married and has one three-year-old child. Christine and her hamily live in Kinyinya- Gasabo- Kigali. She attended school to the secondary level, choosing a Biochemistry option. She is employed by a Pentecostal Church (ADEPR) in the Parish of Gasave, where she is secretary to the Reverend Pastor of the Church. The loan granted by ACB is the 11th. The preceding loans enabled her to improve her family’s living conditions, and the present loan will serve to bring water into her home. Her savings are sufficient to pay the rent where she lives with her family until she can move to the house where she wants to install water pipes. In the future, she plans to stop being an employee and embark on commercial activities. This will of course require another loan, which along with previous savings will stabilise her financial capabilities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of installing water pipes.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Felicitas; tiene 48 años de edad y es madre soltera, ella tiene 1 hijos  trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza por catalogo, La socia trabaja como auxiliar contable en un estudio de contadores, ella paralelamente alterna su trabajo con la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza en oferta venderlos en la siguiente campaña cuando no salga.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 48, is a single mother of a child. She works selling catalogue beauty products. She is also employed as an Accounting Assistant in an accounting office and alternates her beauty product sales with her job. She is a member of the “PADRE URRACA” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is asking for funds to stock up on beauty products that are currently on sale to sell during the next sales campaign when they won’t be available anymore. She avails herself of this forum to express her thanks for the loan as well as to pledge repayment in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products that are currently on sale to sell during the next sales campaign when they aren’t available anymore.

loans.name: Hayde Rose

texts.en:
Hayde Rose B. is a married woman who lives in  Brgy. Manghanoy, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: rice farming, food vending (bananaque) and livestock businesses. Her husband, Fidel, who is 45 years old, works as a farm laborer to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 15 and 17 years old. 

Hayde Rose joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Hayde Rose has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of  7,800 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 22nd cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to maintain her rice field and buy stock for her food vending business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and the expansion of her business. Hayde Rose B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To maintain her rice field and buy stock for her food vending business

loans.name: Delia Hermelinda

texts.es:
La Señora Delia es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle,  su población se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura que es  para su consumo y el sobrante lo vende, mucha de su población ha emigrado en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.
 
Nuestra socia  tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos,el primero de 4 años y su segundo hijo de apenas 7 meses de edad, su esposo trabaja conduciendo maquinaria pesada, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Doña Delia se dedica a trabajar en su pequeña tienda la cual la tiene hace 15 años, labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche de domingo a domingo, también  cría gallinas y tiene una vaca.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace 8 años y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, ahora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, galletas, etc.
 
Su mayor sueño es conservar su salud para poder trabajar como hasta ahora lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the community bank named "The Swan". She lives in the community of San Miguel in the region of Parroquia Del Valle. The population is made up of farmers and agriculturists whose products are used for both personal consumption and for sale. Much of the population has emigrated in search for better a better future for their families. 

Delia is 42 years old. She is married and she has 2 children. The eldest is 4 years old and the youngest is only 7 months old. Her husband is a heavy machinery operator and together they have built their own house.

Delia works in a small store that she has had for more than 15 years. She works from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening, 7 days a week. She also raises chickens and she has a cow. 

She has been a member of the community bank for the past 8 years and the loans she has received have greatly benefited her business. This loan will be invested in the purchase of grocery items to stock her store, such as: rice, sugar, cookies, etc.

Her greatest dream is to remain healthy enough to keep working, as she has to date.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil, eggs, cookies etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new cart and more fresh fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is currently in the business of selling cold drinks like juice, soda, and ice cream, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of soda to sell.  Mary is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has five children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a little restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more crates of soda to sell

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana es madre soltera con tres hijos ya mayores de edad. Ella vende almuerzos en las tarde por $ 1.50. Vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Comenzó vendiendo comidas con algunos ahorros y la experiencia que tenía en vender comidas decidió tener su propio negocio de almuerzos. Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene su pequeño comedor en la parte delantera de su casa donde trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00am hasta que se acaben los almuerzos. El almuerzo viene con jugo, sopa, segundo por solo $ 1.50. 

Ella quiere continuar con su negocio por eso ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, vegetales, legumbres para hacer los almuerzos. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother with three grown-up children.  She sells lunches in the afternoons for $1.50.  She lives in a peri-urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil called Duran which is known for its deteriorating ecosystem.

Ana began selling meals with some savings she had and her previous experience in the business.  She decided to set up her own lunch business.  Owing to this good decision, she now has her own small eatery in the front of her home where she works every day from 6.00am until her lunches have run out.  Her lunches come with juice, soup and main course for only $1.50.

Ana would like to continue with her business and will use her loan to buy rice, vegetables and pulses to make her lunches.  In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables and pulses

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel L. is 43 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a food vending business. She lives in Suba Panas, Brgy Marigondon, Lapu-lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. Ethel is now borrowing PHP 11,000 so that she could purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ethel hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase materials for business

loans.name: Alfiya's Group

texts.en:
Alfiya B., 41, is married to a private taxi-driver. The couple is raising four children, all of whom are pupils in school. 

Traditionally, almost all villagers breed livestock. Alfiya’s family follows this tradition and currently keeps five cows and 15 sheep. Ten years ago, they purchased three sheep and began to fatten them for resale. Currently, the family is being supported financially by Alfiya’s husband. Sometimes in order to get extra money, they have to sell one of their animals. 

The family is planning to purchase an allotment for building a house, thus they need to purchase building materials.

	 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Rady

texts.en:
Mrs. Rady S. (in the photo), 46 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Monh, 47 years old, live in a village along National Road Number Two about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1984 and have seven children - three sons and four daughters. One is married, another one is a garment factory worker and five attend school.

Rady is hired by manufacturers in her village to recycle. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to dig a well for family use, to fill up the land of her house's foundation and to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get to work.

loans.use: To dig a well for family use, to fill up the land of her house's foundation and to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get to work

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
46-year-old Elvira is an entrepreneur from the town of Banga. She is married and has 1 child. She is engaged in farming and particularly plants and harvests rice crops. While her husband does the primary farming duties, she spends time raising chickens. Elvira wishes to be a successful entrepreneur.

Elvira joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday N. is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 35 years old and married with three children — all of them in school. N. has a drug shop dealing in human drugs from Nyakabingo - Katonsi. He has a nurse who helps him attend to patients. His shop is located by the road side and he is able to make 500,000/= as monthly profits. He is grateful for the encouragement of friends and loans from Pearl which support his hard work and commitment. N. needs a loan to be able to purchase more stock to expand his business.

loans.use: Buying more medical supplies.

loans.name: Sergio Mario

texts.es:
El señor R. se dedica a la profesión de albañil con 20 años en esta profesión ,es el quinto crédito que trabaja con ceprodel este crédito lo solicita para cambiar el techo de su casa la cual es de teja y la cambiara por zinc 
Actualmente está casado con dos hijos su esposa es ama de casa 
Gracias a los créditos de ceprodel el señor R. ha logrado poco a poco ir cambiando su vivienda lo que ha permitido tener mayor seguridad para su familia
texts.en:
Mr. R. has worked as a bricklayer for 20 years.  This is his fifth loan through Ceprodel.  He plans to use the loan to change the tile roof he now has on his house for zinc roofing.

He is married, his wife being a homemaker, and they have two children.

Thanks to the loans through Ceprodel Mr. R. has been able to make home improvements which have allowed him to provide more safety for his family.

loans.use: To buy zinc roofing material

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia B. is from the village of Muñoz West. She is 50 years old. Nelia is married and has five children. To make a living, Nelia owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Nelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon K. is 55 years old and married to Sally Chepkosgei who is a house wife. They have 5 children, aged 21, 19, 14, 12 and 8 years old. Solomon owns a grocery in Ndurio trading centre and has been in business for a period of 6 years. His monthly income is KES 8,100.

Solomon has joined KADET LTD and taken a loan of KES 10,000, this being his first loan. He hopes to use the money to purchase onions, tomatoes and green vegetables for his business. The profits will be used to start a retail shop.

His dream is to educate his children to higher levels and also to prosper in the business.

loans.use: To add more retail inventory.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie M., 39 years old, is from the village of Bimonton, Mallig, Isabela. She is married and has an infant. Arcelie operates a specialized retail store, selling mobile electronic and card loads in the local community. Arcelie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Arcelie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arcelie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional mobile loads to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arcelie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional mobile loads to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 23 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Hace 5 años convive con Julio, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Harinson y Medaly; a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Antonio. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de papa y flor de gladiolo, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, ya que según menciona; los propios comercializadores de papa llegan a sus terrenos agrícolas para negociar su cosecha, mientras que la flor de gladiolo, lo vende en el mercado central de flores de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ayudar en los gastos familiares a su esposo; pues comparte el cuidado de sus 3 toros, con los que Julio hace el arado de la tierra, con el mantenimiento de sus terrenos agrícolas. Así ambos se organizan para poder tener ingresos extras y de esa manera poder ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos, a quienes desean brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe, pues le ayuda a invertir en el mejoramiento de sus cultivos. Angélica, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de 3 toros medianos los cuales criará y engordará para luego venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Angélica, 23, is a hard working woman.  She’s been living with Julio for five years.  They have two children: Harinson and Medaly, who she cares for in her own house located in the hamlet of San Antonio.  She’s been a farmer for three years.  Her main crops are potatoes and gladiolas which she cares for with much dedication because, as she mentions, the potato wholesalers come to her fields to negotiate for her crops; she sells the gladiolas at Tarma’s central flower market.


What she enjoys the most about her work is being able to help her husband with household expenses because she shares caring for their three bulls which Julio uses to till the soil and maintain his farmland.  This is how both of them organize themselves to earn extra income and save for their children’s future that they want to provide a better quality of life for.

She’s a member of the “Santa Rosa” communal bank and this is her third loan with MFP.  She’s grateful for the help she receives because it will help her invest in the improvement of her crops.  Angélica will use the requested loan to buy three medium size bulls that she’ll raise and fatten up to sell later at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy three bulls.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer who tills a plot of land in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He primarily grows rice crops to sell to the market. He plans to use his loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Michael is married and has children. He works hard to provide for his family. In the future, he hopes to see his children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Savith

texts.en:
Savith is a motor taxi driver. His wife sells corn and mango. They have five sons. One is a carpenter, three are in school, and the fifth one is still young. The family lives along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Savith hopes to change his business from motor taxi to tuk tuk (three-wheeled auto rickshaw), so he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a tuk tuk.

Photo: Savith and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras Santa Lucía se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Juana contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, se encuentran ya en el 7° ciclo.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
La presidenta, la sra. Juana se dedica a la venta de chipas por las calles de su ciudad, pues es un panificado típico de su país muy consumido en cualquier punto de Paraguay.
Ella aprendió a realizar este producto con ayuda de su madre y lo ha vuelto en su medio de ingresos.
Hoy día ella desea poder aumentar la economia de su familia, por eso solicita ayuda crediticia para poder comprar mas insumos para la preparacion de chipas.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women from the city of Itá is called “Las Emprendedoras Santa Lucía” and they came together thanks to Juana who contacted an advisor during a weekly meeting she was conducting in the area to find out about the working methodology of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women’s Committee).  They are now in their 7th cycle.

They all carry out fund raising activities and help each other to reach the common goals they all have within their group and with Fundación Paraguaya.

The President, Irma, sells “chipás” throughout the streets in her city.  It is a typical bread consumed everywhere in Paraguay.  She learned how to make this product with help from her mother and she’s turned this skill into her source of income.

Today, she’d like to increase her family’s income so is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients to make chipás.

loans.use: to buy cheese and starch.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka comes from the village of Ksovrisi, Mtskheta District. He is 40 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Lali and two sons (17 and 13 years old), both of whom go to school.
Mamuka is requesting credit to repair his minibus, which is the source of income for the family. He uses it in summer and fall to transport villagers and their fruits/vegetables to the open market in Tbilisi (the capital city). The distance between Ksovrisi and Tbilisi is approximately 35km. Mamuka’s minibus is already old and he needs to change some parts in order for it to function safely and provide comfortable transportation for the villagers.
Mamuka also helps Lali in the family-owned dairy farm. They have four milk cows and sell approximately 100kg Georgian cheese in nearby villages.
A small part of the credit will be used for house renovation. After the renovation family members will have better living conditions and a better spirit for hard work.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his minibus, pay for its repair service and purchase materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Deymi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Deymi lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras ellas son Keny, Deimy, Araceli y Marina. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Keny de 23 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y sopa los fines de semana, además tiene una pequeña pulperia. Este negocio lo  inicio con la venta de tortas de papa  y con las ganancias y los créditos fue aumentándolo. 

Ella tiene tres hijos de 7, 4 y 3 años quienes son su inspiración y sueña en tener una gran pulpería.

Mientras Deimi de 22 años vende frijoles cocidos hace 5 años y tiene una pequeña venta, Araceli vende verduras y frutas y Marina es comerciante de prendas de oro y plata y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Deymi Group consists of four hardworking women:  Keny, Deimy, Araceli, and Marina.  The group coordinator is Sra. Keny, age 23.  She sells food and soup on the weekends.  In addition, she manages a small store.  Keny started her business selling potato cakes and has been able to expand by utilizing her profits and loans.  She has three children (ages 7, 4, and 3) who provide her with inspiration.  Keny dreams of having a larger store.  

Deimy, age 22, has been selling cooked beans for five years and also manages a small store.  Araceli sells vegetables and fruits.  Marina is a merchant who sells gold and silver jewelry, as well as cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meat, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a twenty-two-year-old hardworking man who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Three years ago he started as a taxi conductor and now is a driver. His hardship is traffic officers who always charge him unfairly.

Henry wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for his own transport business. His vision is to buy a motorcycle and a motor vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, tiene 50 años, es una mujer  alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eloy de 50 años y sus 02 menores hijos William de 20 y Yaneth de 14años, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. María una mujer de ardua labor se esmera a diario por dar lo mejor a sus 02 queridos hijos. En la ciudad de San Francisco, si uno desea comprar unos zapatos o sandalias acorde a su talla o que sean novedosas, sus clientes no dudan en acudir a la tienda de María. Sus novedosos modelos traídos por ella misma desde la ciudad de Lima, marcan una gran diferencia con la mercadería de la competencia, lo cual ha hecho que su negocio sea muy concurrido. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los zapatos que mejor les queden, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar las lluvias intermitentes que a veces suelen llover sin cesar todo el día y factor a ello sus ventas del día suelen bajar. Menciona que el gasto de educación de sus menores hijos es más grande, razón por la cual acude a los prestamos que la institución MFP facilita, con el dinero obtenido viajará a la capital a comprar más mercaderías que abastezcas su puesto de ventas  y con el resto del dinero pagará la pensión de estudios de sus adorados hijos. Con el tiempo, desea poner otro negocio, esta vez incursionaría en la comida, ya que ha visto que es una buena fuente de ingresos. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda comprar la mercadería que le hace falta y con ello poder tener más ganancias. Agradece a las socias de su banco comunal por la responsabilidad que tienen. Con los 3,000 mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más zapatos y sandalias de la ciudad de Lima, para aumentar el stock que tiene en su tienda.
texts.en:
María is from the city of San Francisco.  She’s 50 years old.  She’s a cheerful, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Eloy, 50, and their two minor children, William, 20, and Yaneth, 14, that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.

María is a hard worker who tries daily to give her best to her two beloved children.  In the city of San Francisco, if one wants to buy a pair of shoes or sandals in one’s size that are stylish customers don’t hesitate to go to María’s store.  Her novel styles brought by herself from the city of Lima stand out among the competition which has made her store quite popular.  What she enjoys the most about her work is advising her customers about which shoes best suit them.  She’s been in business for 10 years and the most difficult part is putting up with the intermittent rain storms which sometimes last all day and cause her sales to drop.

She mentions that educational costs for her minor children are higher and this is why she’s calling on MFP for a loan.  With the money she gets she’ll travel to the capital to buy more merchandise to stock her sales stand and will use the remaining funds to pay for her beloved children’s monthly tuition.  In time, she’d like to start a new business; she’ll go into food sales, since she’s noticed that this is a good source of income.

This will be her 7th loan with MFP and she hopes to get support from all of you to be able to buy the merchandise she needs to have more profits.  She thanks her fellow communal bank members for the responsibility they have.  She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more shoes and sandals in the city of Lima to increase the stock she has on hand at her store.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 34 years old and married to David. They have one child who is three years old.

She has a boutique that has been running for five years. She is applying for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy more clothes, socks, bedsheets and blankets to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a big boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, socks, bedsheets and blankets to add to her stock.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Curuguaty se ha conformado el Comité de Mujeres Santa Librada, el cual se encuentra actualmente en el segundo ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedora de la Fundación Paraguaya. Es un grupo alegre con deseos de superación, demuestran solidaridad entre ellas y ganas de salir adelante como personas y como grupo.
La señora Nilsa se dedica a la venta de prendas desde hace ya mucho tiempo. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y generar los ingresos necesarios para paliar los gastos que surgen el día a día. Uno de sus proyectos es tener un local donde pueda tener las ropas que vende, ya que por medio de esto atraerá más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, para la posterior venta. Tiene las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The women’s communal bank Santa Librada was formed in the city of Curuguaty. They are currently in their second loan cycle with the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program with the Fundación Paraguaya.  This is a joyful group that desires to overcome obstacles.  They show solidarity with each other and wish to make progress as individuals and as a group.

Nilsa has been selling clothes for a long time.  She says that thanks to this work she has been able to go forward and make the income necessary to manage her expenses, which grow day after day.  One of her goals is to have a location where she can sell her clothes, which would allow her to attract more customers.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy clothes for resale.  She sincerely hopes to obtain this loan, as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.ru:
Хошим трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 1 ребенка. Более 2 лет он занимается купля продажей скота. Он откармливает скот дома и имеет хорошие условия для них. Его жена помогает ему бизнесу, она ухаживает и откармливает скот, когда Хошим ездит за покупками. Он продает скот на местном рынке. Кроме этого он имеет землю и там он выращивает сельскохозяйственных культур, а также корм для своего скота. Хошим старается, содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни, и обеспечить своего ребенка. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки скота, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать своего дохода. Хошим благодарен всем кто поддерживает его. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Hoshim is a hard-working and conscientious person.  He is married and is a loving father of one child.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over two years.  He fattens up livestock at home and has suitable conditions for it there.  His wife helps him in this business.  She takes care of and feeds the livestock, when Hoshim goes shopping.  He sells livestock at the local market.  Besides this business, he has land, where he grows agricultural crops and feed for his livestock.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock, in order to expand his business and maximize his income.  Hoshim is grateful to all who supports him.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Gladis Mabel

texts.es:
Gladis, ella vive con sus padres, no tiene hijos, administra una tienda, en la que ofrece de todo tipo de artículo, vende todos los días, los clientes son vecinos cercanos.
Ella quiere comprar productos que los clientes le solicitan: papel higiénico, pastas de tomate, aceite, azúcar, arroz, jabón y detergentes. Esta compra le ayudara para aumentar el inventario y mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Gladis aspira tener un negocio estable, fortalecido con la ayuda de préstamos, mejorando su estilo de vida y apoyando a sus padres.
texts.en:
Gladis lives with her parents.  She does not have any children.  She runs a store where she sells all kinds of products.  She works every day and her customers are close neighbors.

Gladis would like to buy products that her customers ask her for such as toilet paper, tomato purée, oil, sugar, rice, soap and detergents.  This purchase will help her to increase her stock and to improve her customer service.

Gladis aspires to have a stable business which she will strengthen with the help of loans.  She would like to improve her lifestyle and support her parents.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, tomato purée, oil, sugar and rice

loans.name: Normandina

texts.es:
La señora Normandina tiene 58 años de edad, es viuda y madre de cinco hijos, reside en la Colonia Moncada Lobo en el municipio de Juticalpa y se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano.

Doña Normandina inicio a vender ropa usada hace mas de 10 años, trabaja conjunto a uno de sus hijos y lo hacen de forma ambulante. Todos los dias muy temprano por las mañanas salen a las aldeas mas cercanas a realizar  ventas y luego regresan a casa por las tardes.  Normandina no sufre algún padecimiento grave, gracias a Dios es una persona sana, pero tiene una nieta con problemas en su vista y ya ha sido sometida  a tres operaciones, actualmente la niña perdió  totalmente su vista y no puede ver. 

Doña Normandina solicita este préstamo para comprar tres fardos de ropa usada y así poder seguir teniendo una actividad económica que le permita sostenerse y ayudar a su nietecita con los gastos médicos de su enfermedad.

Su sueño es ver a su nieta recuperada y tener un local propio para ya no andar vendiendo de forma ambulante y exponiéndose a la delincuencia. 

Doña Normandina tiene cuatro ciclos en FAMA y es una clienta muy puntual con los pagos.
texts.en:
Señora Normandina is 58 years old. She is a widow and mother of 5 children. She lives in the Colonia Moncada Lobo in the town of Juticalpa and she sells second hand clothes.

Doña Normandina started selling used clothes more than 10 years ago. She works with one of her children selling the clothes as street vendors. Every day very early in the morning they travel to the nearby villages to sell and then they come home in the afternoons. Normandina does not suffer from any serious medical condition; 'gracias a Dios' (thanks be to God) she is a healthy person but she has a granddaughter who has problems with her eyesight and has undergone 3 operations. The girl has now completely lost her eyesight and cannot see.

Doña Normandina is asking for the loan to purchase 3 bundles of used clothes so that she can continue to have an economic activity that gives her an upkeep and allows her to help her granddaughter with the medical expenses of her illness.

Her dream is to see her granddaughter recovered and to have her own premises so as to no longer be a street vendor exposed to crime.

Doña Normandina has 4 loan cycles with FAMA and is very punctual with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a hardworking business woman. She is 25 years old and blessed with one child who is still in school. For the last five years, she has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. She also farms to earn extra income. She has retained her business because of the good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy sugar, maize flour, and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, and maize flour.

loans.name: Ozodbek

texts.ru: Озодбек энергичный предприниматель . Он разведен. Занимается предоставлением строительных услуг - отделка помещений, кровля крыш. Кроме того у него скот для откорма и дальнейшей продажи. Он хочет получить займ для покупки пиломатериалов и шифера для крыш. Он надеется получить займ для дальнейшей деятельности.
texts.en: Ozodbek is an energetic entrepreneur.  He is divorced.  He is involved in providing construction services, such as interior finishes and roofing.  Besides this, he keeps livestock for fattening up and subsequent sale.  Ozodbek wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of timber and slate for roofs.  He hopes to obtain this loan for future business activity.

loans.use: to buy timber and slate for roofs

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is a 59-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan who has one child.

Years ago, An purchased a used sewing machine and started her business sewing clothes. Now she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase a modern sewing machine.

An is looking to improve her business by employing other people and opening her own shop for sewing.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is An's husband.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing mchine and material

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is married with 4 children aged 5 to 12. He has been a maize farmer for 37 years. He would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to grow his crop. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to grow his crop.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar, de 20 años es una joven madre soltera. Vive en el caserío de Acolla, junto a su madre e hijo Damian. Gracias al terreno que le heredó su mamá ella puede sembrar papa, maíz y alverja, esto le permite adquirir algunos ingresos para su hijo y ella. Cuenta que en épocas de cosecha trabaja como peón en otros terrenos agrícolas, así puede juntar dinero para su próxima siembra. Aun cuenta con pequeños sembríos pero eso no la desanima, ya que tiene las ganas de seguir triunfando sobre todo porque es una mujer que no se rinde con facilidad. Ahora desea abrir peluquería, ya dio el primer paso con la adquisición de un pequeño local, donde comenzará a realizar cortes, peinados y maquillajes, puso sillas y espejos. Le falta muy poco y está segura de concretar su objetivo.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadoras” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr su objetivo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo integran personas responsables y solidarias. Pilar de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero del préstamo en la compra de utensilios para su peluquería.
texts.en:
Pilar is 20 years old and a single mother.  She lives in the Acolla neighborhood, together with her mother and her son, Damian.  Thanks to the land that her mother inherited, she can plant potatoes, corn, and peas; this provides some income for herself and her son.  During periods of harvest, she also works as a laborer in other farms so she can raise money her next planting.  Her few crops do not discourage her.  She desires to triumph over everything because she is a woman who does not give up easily.

Now, she would like to open a beauty salon.  Pilar already took the first step by acquiring a small premises where she will begin to cut and style hair, as well as do makeup for her patrons.  She has set up seats and mirrors; she only needs a few remaining things and is sure of realizing her goal.  

She belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadores" ("Fighting Women").  This is her first loan with MFP, where she hopes for all of your support to achieve her goal.  She promises to make her loan payments punctually, as her communal bank is composed of responsible individuals who support each other.  Upon receiving your support, Pilar will invest the loan to purchase items for her hair salon.

loans.use: To buy materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Elmie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverage. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Elmie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 59 años vive con su cónyuge y tiene  6 hijos de 18 a 36 años. Él se dedica a la venta de repuestos para electrodomésticos menores y también ofrece servicios de mantenimiento y de reparación de los mismos. Su actividad emprendedora la inició desde hace 37 años vendiendo chancletas, pero poco a poco, aplicó a la  clientela su  conocimiento técnico  y ganó más mercado.    Su negocio está vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, hace 20 años, durante los cuales ha recibido 28 financiamientos, con ellos  ha logrado crecer expandirse, diversificar su oferta y  atender la educación de sus hijos.  Cuando inició con la FMSD lo hizo en la modalidad de grupos solidarios, pero su crecimiento lo orilló a acceder a sus créditos individuales de los cuales ha recibido 8. Su mayor desafío ha sido la muerte de su esposa hace 4 años, quien fue su compañera idónea y su “mano derecha” en el negocio.  En la actualidad comparte los gastos familiares con sus tres hijos.  En su negocio también aprovecha cada temporada;  así muchas veces vende útiles escolares, en Diciembre juguetes y adornos navideños, pero nunca deja de comercializar sus artículos estrellas, que son los repuestos para licuadoras, planchas, ollas y otros electrodomésticos menores. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva,  con el cual comprará repuestos en mayor cantidad para ganar descuentos y responderá a su clientela navideña que ya está solicitando sus servicios.
texts.en:
Manuel is 59 years old and lives with a partner and he has 6 children from 18 to 36 years old. He works selling spare parts for small electrical appliances and he also offers his services to repair them. He began his business 37 years ago selling sandals, but little by little, he applied his technical knowledge to gain more market share. He has been working through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 20 years, and during this time he has received 28 loans, which helped him to expand, diversify his business and pay for his children’s education.

When he started with FMSD it was as a member of solidarity groups, but his growth steered him towards initiating his own individual loans, which have been 8 in number. 

His biggest challenge has been the death of his wife 4 years year ago, who was his companion and right-hand in the business. 

Currently he shares the family expenses with his three children. In his business he also takes advantage of each season, so many times he sells school supplies. In December he sells toys and Christmas decorations, but he never stops selling his principal items which are the spare parts for blenders, irons, pots and other small electrical household appliances. He is asking for his first Kiva loan, with which he will buy spare parts in greater amounts in order to respond to his Christmas clients who are already asking for his services.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in larger quantities in order to get discounts, and so he can respond to the request of the holiday season clients

loans.name: Airforce Group

texts.en:
Monika, who is in her late 30s, is married and has one small grandchild and six children, four of them go to school.  She has been running a food vendor business since 2000.  She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase her food stock and sell more food. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Monika will share this loan with her loan group "Airforce", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: buy more food to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: El señor Rigoberto se encuentra dedicado a la mecánica, actividad con la que genera el sustento necesario para su esposa y sus dos hijos. Gracias a que esta ubicado en la autopista a la entrada de su municipio, Rigoberto cuenta con una buena clientela que le genera al menos los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Debido a que no cuenta con un taller totalmente equipado, a Rigoberto se le escapa la oportunidad de atender a mayor cantidad de clientes en su taller. El sueño de Rigoberto es poder aumentar los empleados en su taller de modo que pueda ayudar a personas mas necesitadas y también poder brindarles a sus hijos la educación que necesitan.
texts.en: Rigoberto works as a mechanic, and with this activity he generates the income needed to support his wife and their two children.  Rigoberto has a lot of customers, due to the fact that his business is located on the highway at the entrance to his town, and so his business generates the income he needs for his household.  Since his workshop is not fully equipped, Rigoberto misses the opportunity to serve more customers in his shop.  Rigoberto's dream is to be able to increase the number of employees in his workshop so that he could help out some needy people and also be able to provide his children with the education that they need.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe SOUTOURA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à NOUMOUSSO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de KADIOLO (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
SANATA au milieu sur la photo fait la transformation et vente de beurre de karité dans ce groupe de femmes SOUTOURA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une dizaine de sacs de100kg de noix de karités. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de Kadiolo ville et souvent au grand marché de la ville de Kadiolo le jour de foire.
Elle les vend après transformation en beurre de karité au marché les jours de foires  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant.  
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the "Soutoura" group are mostly married women, on average 36 years old with 3 children. They live mainly in polygamous households in Noumousso, one of the working-class areas in the city of Kadiolo (3rd administrative region of Mali).
They are on their seventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. The previous loans were repaid properly.
Sanata, in the middle of the photo, makes and sells shea butter as part of the Soutoura women's group.
With her loan, she intends to buy ten 100-kg bags of shea nuts. She gets her supplies in the towns surrounding the city of Kadiolo and often at the grand market in the town of Kadiolo during market-days.
She processes the nuts into shea butter and sells them at home and at the market on market-days, in cash, to a clientele composed of men and women.
She foresees earning an average monthly profit of 23,500 FCFA, of which one portion is used to repay the loan and its interest, with the rest going to her savings.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Бахтиёр молодой и жизнерадостный парень 30 лет. Он   женат и имеет двоих детей. Его жену зовут Гулбахор. Бахтиер очень трудолюбивый мужчина. Бахтиёр любит семью и старается для семейного благополучия. Он работает на автозаправке «КОРВОН» заправщиком.
  Бахтиер хочет провести мероприятие в честь обрезания своего сына.  Он обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor is a cheerful 30-year-old young man. He is married and has two children. His wife is named Gulbahor. Bahtiyor is a very hardworking man. Bahtiyor loves his family and does all that he can for his family's wellbeing. He works in the "KORVON" car service station as a refueling operator.

Bahtiyor wants to throw a celebration. He turned to MDO Arvand for a loan. He thanks you in advance for the support.

loans.use: to pay for party of his son

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine! This is 35-year-old Haitham from Nablus city. He is married with one kid aging 4 years, and currently attending nursery.
Haitham runs a car workshop where he repair Opel car bodies and paints them. He has been running this business for eight years. Haitham says that the main challenge to his business is the stoppage of Opel's car spare parts supplies. Haitham required this loan in order to buy new equipment for repair shop. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to expand and improve his business and the workshop. 
In the future, Haitham plans to buy a new garage with wider area than the current one and increase his project capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for Opel car body repairs

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Komlan S. was born in Lomé on February 21, 1967. Married and the father of two, he entered a carpentry apprenticeship after earning his middle school diploma. Today, he is definitely a master carpenter with three apprentices working under him in his own workshop. Opening his shop was possible due to financial support in the amount of $450, which he promptly repaid. Making cabinets, armchairs (living room furniture), armoires, buffet tables, and beds, among others items, are his specialty. His fine work only brings in more customers! But unfortunately his financial means are limited when it comes to satisfying on a timely basis the stated expectations of his customers. This situation might create a crisis of trust with his customers.

To overcome this problem and to earn the loyalty of his customers, Mr. S. is requesting a new loan of $1,200 to buy Iroko and Teck boards, rafters, and hand tools in order to be able to satisfy his customers’ orders on time. The loan will grow his business and thus increase his income considerably to better support his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur S. Komlan est né le 21 Février 1967 à Lomé. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, il entra dans l’apprentissage de menuiserie après avoir obtenu le CEPD. Il est aujourd’hui un maître menuisier confirmé avec trois (03) apprentis à charge et a son propre atelier. L’ouverture de cet atelier a été possible grâce à un appui financier de $450 obtenu et promptement remboursé. La fabrication des meubles, des fauteuils (salon complet), des armoires et buffets, des lits sont entre autres sa spécialité. Par son travail bien fait, sa clientèle ne fait qu’accroître, mais malheureusement ses moyens financiers se trouvent très limités pour satisfaire à temps les demandes exprimées. Ce qui risque de créer une crise de confiance avec sa clientèle.

Pour palier à ce problème et fidéliser sa clientèle, Monsieur S. sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1200 pour l’achat des planches en Iroko et Teck, des chevrons et de petit outillage afin de pouvoir satisfaire dans le délai les commandes de ses clients. Ceci accroîtra ses activités et augmentera considérablement ses revenus pour mieux entretenir sa famille.

loans.use: To buy hand tools and the basic materials for carpentry and furniture-making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Caroline Wanjiru intends to buy households’ goods and cereals foodstuff

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en: Tausi is not married and she has one child. She runs a hairdressing business in a busy area of Mtoni-Mtongani in Dar es Salaam. She employs one assistant in her business. She wants to improve the condition of her business premises by adding enough chairs for customers waiting in queue, a ceiling fan, and hairdressing supplies. She also wants to replace a hair dryer which has started to malfunction due to its age. The equipment used for hairdressing needs to be highly sterilized to reduce the risk of HIV transmission and skin diseases. To effectively run her business, she needs additional working capital of USD 750.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: "I derive joy in knitting caps, cardigans and babywear. I wish to invest the loan that will been given to me, by purchasing knitting materials," said Mrs. E. Francisca. She is 35 years old, married with a child, and a native of Enugu State of Nigeria, but residing in Asaba Delta State. She has been in this business since 1998.

loans.use: To buy more knitting materials

loans.name: Pura

texts.en:
Pura works hard to support 6 people in her family. She raises and sells pigs to local community members, but recently spent a lot of money on a pig that became sick and died. She is requesting this small loan so that she will be able to buy plantains from local Haitian workers to sell to her community members. With this loan she hopes that she can begin to regain some of the money she lost when her pig died, and eventually get back on her feet again with her business.

Pura's dream is to one day build a home out of concrete blocks, with a concrete roof and floor, and to also have a separate room where she can prepare the pork that she sells to her neighbors.

NOTE: Pura is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Unidos Podemos (United We Are Able) Bank of Hope solidarity group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying $60 each of this $300 loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Purchase plantains for resale

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba’s husband is a contractor, and together they have two children, one teenager and one ten-year-old, who need help to be able to get ahead and not go down the wrong path in life. That’s why Rosalba has fought to give the best of herself to her children without neglecting them all day, and why she dedicated herself to sales: her schedule is flexible, and her earnings are seasonal. She began by selling one brand of beauty products out of catalogs, and now she sells many brands to give her customers more variety.

Nevertheless, when combined with the little her husband earns, her daily fight goes on to raise money to pay the costs of the household and her children, who are doing very well in school. For her children, she is requesting a loan of $575 over a six-month term. With this money, she will be able to buy more merchandise and offer a wider variety to her customers through the Christmas season. With your help, Rosalba can get her children ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El esposo de Rosalba es contratista y junto con él tiene 2 hijos, uno en la adolescencia y el otro de 10 años, los cuales necesitan apoyo para poder salir adelante y no meterse en malos caminos de la vida. Es por eso que Rosalba a luchado por darles lo mejor a sus hijos, sin descuidarlos todo el día. Y fue así que se dedicó a las ventas, así su horario es flexible y las ganancias son dependiendo las temporadas. Comenzó por vender productos de belleza por catálogos de una marca y hoy cuenta ya con otras marcas, para así poderle dar más variedad a sus clientas.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue, para poder sacar dinero diariamente, y asú junto con lo poco que gana su esposo poder pagar los gastos de su casa y los gastos de sus dos hijos que hasta hoy van muy bien en la escuela. Por sus hijos está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerles más variedad a sus clientas en la temporada navideña. Con tu ayuda Rosalba podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of goods to offer her customers

loans.name: Wati

texts.en: Wati is 30 years old and has a duck livestock business at her house. She has to raise them before selling them. She can earn US $2.50 per week. Her husband, E., has no fixed income. She needs a loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hassanatu

texts.en: Hassanatu is married with three children and sells local food (a rice-and-cassava-leaves dish) in Kabala town in Sierra Leone.  She sells other items beside the main food business.  With a previous loans she increased her stock of ingredients and the profit has enabled her to support her two school-going children.  She makes a good profit from the restaurant, but she needs more capital to meet the increased demand for food in the community.

loans.use: Hassanatu would like to increase her stock of ingredients.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is from Raquina and for her entire life she has been involved in agricultural work. She is of the mentality that work requiring a great deal of effort brings her the most satisfaction. She has always sought to reap the best possible results from her crops and has cared for her animals in order to profit and be able to provide for her 6 children. In addition to growing corn and peas, Beatriz raises sheep, cows, pigs, hens, and guinea pigs. On a daily basis, she puts forth all of her effort and patience in order to care for them and make sure that they remain healthy and strong for sales and consumption. For the next sowing season, she is asking for a loan in order to be able to increase her production and in order to gain greater earnings that will allow her to contribute more to the dreams of success of her dear children.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz, es natural de Raquina y toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades agrícolas con la mentalidad de un trabajo de largo esfuerzo que ofrece satisfacción.Ella siempre ha luchado para asegurarse de que los resultados de su siembra y el cuidado de sus animales tengan un resultado muy provechoso para el sustento de sus 6 hijos, cultiva verduras, además de maíz y arveja y entre los animales que cría podemos observar a la oveja, a las vacas, a los cerditos, a las gallinas y a los cuyes, a diario despliega toda su fuerza y paciencia en su cuidado para mantenerlos sanos y fuertes para su posterior venta y/o consumo.Para esta próxima siembra solicita un préstamo a fin de incrementar los productos de siembra y obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan contribuir con el cumplimiento de los sueños de éxito de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to acquire a larger quantity of better seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lake H D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ziriat K.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase local poultry. Ziriat is 50 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from age16 to 30. Each week, Ziriat makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business and repay the loan. Ziriat has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more poultry and the loan was paid back on time.

Ziriat is joined in her small group by Irene N., Edisa M., and Jesca M.. Irene N. has a business selling used clothes and wants to increase her purchases. Edisa M. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to purchase more fish. Jesca M. operates a business selling shoes and wants to expand the business.

loans.use: To add to local poultry business

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny K. M. is a trader who sells building materials. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family so Fanny is working very hard to support her husband. She wants to expand her business but lacks capital.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital for the expansion of the business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu M. sells plastic sandals in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. She has been running the business for a year with very little capital. With three children and an unemployed husband, Kadiatu works hard to meet her family's needs.

She would like to expand her busines and rent a table in the market or another strategic location in the town, from which to run her business instead of hawking. She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.800,000. Kadiatu is 25 years old and married with 3 children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of plastic sandals

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Bernadetha Lagita is 33 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 6 and 13. She has two dependents, who live with her because they are attending school in the area. In 2007, Bernadetha started her poultry business.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and add more as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing, they produce eggs. You can sell the eggs to provide a supplementary source of income, or eat them to provide a supplementary source of protein. There are probably many other reasons for raising kuku, but this is all time and space will allow.

Bernadetha requests a loan to purchase additional chicks and feed so she can increase her income. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed

loans.name: Hafizan's Group

texts.en:
Hafizan baji, the widow of Muhammad B., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan where she owns a mud house that has been her residence for the last 10 years. She is the mother of eight children: five sons and three daughters. Two daughters and two sons are married. Hafizan baji sells garments and does household work. Having successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), she is now applying for a new one to buy more garments to expand her business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Shamim baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell; Sumera baji wants to buy a sewing machine for a tailoring business; Nasreen baji and Safia baji want loans to buy buffalo.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida (her son is pictured) was born in 1963. She lives in Khachmaz region. This woman is the mother of 3 children. 6 years ago she started a cattle breeding business. Now she needs a loan of US$ 875 to buy a calf and the baling presses to improve her cattle breeding.

loans.use: to buy a calf and baling presses

loans.name: Wanu

texts.en:
Wanu is 24 and she is married. She has run her own shop since February, 2008. Every day, she works from 6AM to 8PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Wanu is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Abduzoir

texts.en:
S. Abduzoir is an entrepreneurial cattleman who is married and has four children. He yearns to make his small business into a big family business so that he can improve the quality of life for his wife and children. He currently has three cows and a calf. He grows his own feed for them in order to improve the quality of the milk they produce. His desire to grow his business has led him to improve his production techniques, so that he can distribute the milk to his clients in a timely manner.  

Abduzoir wants to buy additional cows to increase the amount of milk and gradually establish a store in his house where he will sell high-quality dairy products. To do this, Abduzoir is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD), which he is committed to repaying over a period of 12 months.
