La preparación de todos los alimentos requiere de mucha inversión en cuanto al gas que la señora usa, por este motivo ella desea compra una cocina eléctrica con planchas de  dos hornallas  ya que este no consumiría  mucha energía.
texts.en:
The “Renacer” (To be Reborn) committee was born over two years ago thanks to the initiative and support from another committee active in that place at that time. This committee is in Barcequillo and during these two years of intense work they have grown both socially and economically; they are known there for being very hard-working women. One of the workers is Idalina who sells prepared food to people who pass by her house. Among the items she prepares are: turnovers, breaded steaks, fish stews, locros (a stew composed chiefly of winter squash, potatoes, tender corn, meat or fish), bori-bori (a chicken soup with corn dumplings), etc. Preparation of all these dishes requires a heavy investment due to gas consumption. Because of this, she wants to buy an electric stove with two-burner slates because they will not use as much energy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an electric stove.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita A. is 62 years old, married, and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and four children. To provide additional profits for her family, Cristita is opening a local sari-sari (variety) store in her neighborhood.

Cristita would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory including 10 sacks of rice, sugar, five sacks of charcoal, and inventory of other foodstuff for her store. Cristita believes in offering a relevant variety and inventory of goods in her store for customers looking for convenient purchases, and to attract more customers in local community. As a good member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Cristita is thankful for the access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.

Her long term goals are to develop her retail business, finance the college education of her four children, and support her family morally and financially.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to win more business with her new entrepreneurial effort.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her variety store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es enfermera y estudio en la prestigiosa Universidad San Antonio Abad del Cusco. Actualmente, la socia trabaja en el colegio San José de la Sallé. Ya son 6 años que trabaja atendiendo a los alumnos, Margarita trabaja en dos turnos, el primer turno empieza a las 9 de mañana hasta las 12 del medio día y el segundo turno empieza a las 3 de la tarde hasta las 4 de la tarde, ella trabaja todos los días. 

Margarita nos cuenta que en el colegio dictaron clases de manualidades y la socia participo en las clases y entonces le enseñaron a confeccionar peluches.

Margarita es socia nueva en el banco comunal y requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar peluches como por ejemplo tela peluche, hilos, agujas y moldes. El sueño de la socia es abrir una tienda de peluches.
texts.en:
Margarita is 31, married, and has two children. She is a nurse and studied at the prestigious University of San Antonio Abad of Cusco. Currently the member works at the San José de la Sallé school. She has been there for 6 years taking care of the students. Margarita works on two shifts: the first shift begins at 9 in the morning and finishes at 12 noon, and the second shift begins at 3 in the afternoon and finishes at 4 pm. She works every day. Margarita tells us that in the school classes are taught in different skills and this member took the classes and learned how to make stuffed animals. Margarita is a new member in the communal bank and needs the loan to buy materials to make the stuffed animals such as the fabric, thread, needles and patterns. This member's dream is to open a stuffed animal store.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make stuffed animals such as the fabric, thread, needles and patterns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire laborers for her farm and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: removed per borrower request

loans.name: Fuapine

texts.en: Fuapine F. is 48 and single with six children aged 2 to 6. She owns a business venture, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Fuapine needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or approximately US$130 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Fuapine joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda H. is a widow who lives in Prk. Bukang Liwayway, Brgy. Tanglaw, Puerto Princesa, Palawan. She earns her living by operating four business ventures: building rental, pension houses, tricycle operator and a general store. Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 23,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,800, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to pay for building maintenance that will be very helpful in her business and to continue to save up for future house renovation. Erlinda H. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Building maintenance

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucila   es viuda,  tiene un copetín y venta D. bebidas en el km 7_ Don Bosco, el trabajo D. la  misma es gratificante, ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad D. cliente, y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.

Con la ayuda D. su hija   están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
Hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresaria exitosa y en constante progreso.
Es muy cumplidora con sus compromisos por lo que merece el debido apoyo para seguir creciendo.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra D. bebidas.
texts.en:
Lucila is widowed and has a liquor store and drink sales business at the 7th kilometer of Don Bosco. She finds her work fulfilling, now that she has plenty of customers and a satisfying income. With the help of her daughter, a strong will, dedication, and hard work, they are getting ahead. She is established as a successful small company, and is constantly moving forward. [Lucila] always fulfills her commitments and is deserving of the support she needs to continue to grow. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drink inventory

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos quienes son su motivo de adoración. El trabajo al que se dedica Nelly, es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, en su bodega que tiene instalada en un espacio dentro de su casa. Cuando empezó con el comercio, se inició vendiendo medicamentos genéricos, pero lamentablemente no le fue nada bien, ya que aparecieron la grandes cadenas farmacéuticas. Desde entonces se vio en la necesidad de cambiar de rubro, es ahí cuando vende productos de primera necesidad, que hoy en día continua con la venta y le va muy bien, ya han transcurrido 20 años en esta labor y mantiene el mismo carisma y ganas de atender a su clientela, procurando además que su bodega esté más surtida. Para en el futuro, planea diversificar su negocio, con la instalación de un bazar – Librería. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y sabe que de tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, porque las integrantes son muy responsables y honestas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará arroz, azúcar, productos lácteos y sobre todo cerveza, ya que en la cerveza capta mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 40, is a hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and her three children who she adores. Nelly sells basic necessities from a store that is established in a designated space in her house. When she first started her business, Nelly sold generic medicines but did not do very well because she had to compete with the large pharmacy chains. Seeing the need to switch to another field, she began selling basic necessities and continues to do so today. Nelly has been in business now for 20 years and has done very well. She continues to possess a charismatic personality and the desire to serve her customers. In addition, she is always mindful of keeping her store well-stocked. Later on, Nelly wants to diversify her business by adding a bazaar and a bookstore.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP. Nelly knows that she must submit her payments on time and is willing to do so. She is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because the members are responsible and honest. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, dairy products, and beer so that she can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, dairy products, and beer

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en:
Mateo D. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 67 years old. Mateo is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Mateo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Mateo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mateo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mateo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mateo is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mateo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Zakaria Muteti

texts.en:
Zakaria has been repairing bicycles and motorbikes in Naivasha town for the last 10 years. He is 48 years old, married to Ruth Nduku and they have 2 children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more spare parts for his shop.

In the future, Zakaria hopes to open a bigger motorcycle repair shop and also be a supplier of spare parts to other repair shops within Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma D. C., age 40, provides manicure and pedicure services in her local community in the village of Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Wilma and her husband have six school-aged children. 
 
In 2007, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide services. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase necessary materials. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Wilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide manicure and pedicure services

loans.name: Roselfina

texts.es: Roselfina tiene 29 años de edad, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años trabaja en las tareas del campo, ella es una emergente agricultora y ganadera, posee vacas y una granja de cuyes, a lo que cuida todas las mañanas, alimentándolos y limpiando su granja. Para ella es muy importante que estos animales tengan el peso exacto, de eso depende para que los pueda vender rápidamente. Por otro lado, la leche que extrae de su vaca, es vendida,  de esa manera obtiene ingresos adicionales. Asimismo cuida de sus cultivos de alfalfa, ya que este producto sirve de forraje para sus animales. Por ahora su prioridad es ampliar la granja de cuyes. Es su crédito número 9 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa y maíz,  así como también en la compra de un toro.
texts.en:
Roselfina is 29 years of age and lives with her husband and three children in her own home. She has been working in rural activities for five years and is an emerging crop and livestock farmer. She owns cattle and a guinea pig farm which she tends to every morning, feeding the animals and cleaning their farm. She considers it very important that these animals have the exact weight so that she will be able to sell them quickly. In addition, the milk she derives from her cattle is sold and in this way she earns an additional income. Likewise she also looks after her alfalfa crops since this product is used as forage for her animals. 

Right now her priority is to expand the guinea pig farm. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she also appreciates being part of her communal bank since all the members are responsible and mutually supportive persons. She also thanks all the people who will be originators of the loan she seeks as it will be very useful to her in the development of her business. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of bags of fertilizer for planting alfalfa and corn as well as for the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer for her corn and alfalfa crops. She would also like to buy a bull.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun S. is a 38-year-old married woman and a local villager living in the Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops on her land in order to earn income to support her family’s expenses. Her husband also assists her in farming business. This family makes an average profit of $2.50 per day. They have three children, who are all single. 

Mrs. Chhun S. would like a loan in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. Mrs. Chhun S. will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. Mrs. Chhun S. was not available on the day of the photograph, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for a farming business.

loans.name: Samuel Nganga

texts.en:
Samuel is 55 years old.  He is married to Jennifer Mugure. They have four children between 25 and 14 years old. He has been selling new and used clothes for a period of 15 years.  His income is about Kshs 9,500 per month.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD.  He wants to use the loan to buy new and second hand clothes for sale. He hopes to buy more clothes and become a great businessman, buy a piece of land, and offer his children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy new and second hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannak Y. is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Thearith Chan, is 28 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2007 and have one young son.   

Vannak and her husband are farmers and raise pigs. When free, Vannak also sells vegetables, and her husband drives a motor taxi. 

She is asking for her first loan of $800 to purchase feed for the pigs and to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

Photo: Mrs. Vannak Y. and her husband

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs and to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Having attained elementary education, Merlinda M., 44, wants to achieve more in life, not just for herself but for her family as well. Merlinda lives in Baseco Port Area, Manila, with her husband, Rosendo M., who is a construction worker. They have two children, both of whom are in elementary grades now.

Merlinda has been in the direct sales business for a few years. She offers branded apparel, cosmetics, footwear, accessories, etc. She buys these items at a discounted price and in bulk quantities and sells them to customers at the regular prices indicated in their product catalogs. Usually she earns at least 25% of the price in the catalog. Her customers are her neighbors, friends, relatives and the community.  Merlinda earns at least PHP 5,000 monthly.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting for a PHP 10,000 loan. She plans to use this loan to purchase items ordered in advance by her customers. Also she plans to purchase items that are usually ordered by her customers to immediately cater their orders. She believes that through this loan, she will be able to expand her inventory and increase her earning capacity.

She hopes that her business will continue to grow, generate more savings and help her to send her children all the way through college. She and her husband are also planning to build and manage their own bakery some day.  

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends their weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell and also to pay for items ordered in advance by her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an industrial stove, a small freezer, vegetables, fruit and other products to increase her sales

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna G., 40 years old and a resident of Caloocan City in the Philippines. She is married to Arbi G., a mechanic, and she is the mother to their four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorna operates a variety store where she also does a little direct selling of cosmetics, clothing and footwear. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of $9.50 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lorna hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to be able to help her neighbors and community through her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan is a married man living in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

He has operated a butcher shop business for the past three years, selling to his neighbours and passersby.  Ramadhan faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase a freezer for his butcher shop. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loans.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for his butcher shop business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a widow who lives in Negros Occidental, Philippines. She earns her living by operating a general store. She has two children who are 25 and 37 years old. 

Thelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Thelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,200, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to pay for more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future to expand her business. Thelma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gemma's Group

texts.en:
Gemma R. is from the village of Estrada. She is 43 years old. Gemma is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Gemma R. Group.

Gemma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a food stall near the school. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional soft drinks and bread to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional soft drinks and bread to sell

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca tiene 58 años. Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura,  tiene más de 6 años de tener esta actividad, es una persona muy responsable y disfruta  de tener este medio de vida. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos del hogar, ya que ella necesita de este medio de vida. A pesar de no tener muchos productos inicio con lo necesario para salir adelante. El financiamiento es para la compra de telas, agujas, hilos, tijeras entre otros productos necesarios. Ella sueña con aumentar los ingresos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is 58 years old and has a sewing business.  She has more than six years experience in this business.  She is a very responsible woman and enjoys her work.  Juana started out doing this work because she needed to cover her household expenses.  She needs to do this work.  In spite of the fact that she didn't have many products, she started out with the basic essentials she needed in order to get ahead.

Juana will use this loan to buy fabric, needles, threads, scissors and other products she needs.  She dreams of increasing her household income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, threads, scissors and other products she needs

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 46 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, milk, groceries, etc. 

Chita has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening and rice retailing.

Chita aspires to save money to expand her business and able to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 29 years old and married with two children, aged 9 and 5 years old. She is a farmer who has been growing rice for five years. She tills her own land and prepares it well making sure her crops grow healthy. She also opened a sari-sari (variety) store to help meet her family's daily needs. Rosalyn earns 7000 PHP per month from her rice farm and store.

Rosalyn's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to start another business. She wants to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells fish. She is 22 years old and married with four children, one of whom goes to school. Rose borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose Douglas

texts.es:
Jose Douglas tiene 37 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con dos hijos de 5 y 4 años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol y un poco en palma africada desde hace 10 años, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos, además le gustaría invertir un poco en cultivar palma africana.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. No enfrenta desafiios muy graves. Su sueño es comprar una casa grande.

Le gusta trabajar y practicare indor.
texts.en:
Jose Douglas is 37 years old, married and living with his wife and two children who are 5 and 4 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

This communal bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and is located in Cachely Grande which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

José has been a farmer, especially of corn, rice and beans and some African Palm for ten years.  He does his purchases in the “Hermanos Olivos” supermarket every month and his sales take place in the local farmers market.

He requested the loan to buy seed and manure for his crops.  He’d also like to invest a bit in the purchase of African Palms to grow.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He isn’t facing any serious challenges.  His dream is to buy a large house.

He enjoys working and playing Indor (type of soccer).

loans.use: to buy seed and manure for his crops and also to invest a bit in African Palm crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children, shoes, perfumes, and jewelry.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been a farmer for the last 10 years. He is 27 years old and married. His wife is a housewife and they are blessed with two children. He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. Since this is his second loan. he plans to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Younis

texts.en:
Younis is a 41 year old married man, father of four children, who has been working raising bees since 5 years ago. He used to be a soldier, but he is retired now. Younis loves his business a lot, and enjoys raising bees a lot. He states that dealing and treating the bees in a kind way is sufficient enough to get the best honey, and the best relationship with them. 

Younis is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary tools to increase his business. Younis works hard on improving his business, and hopes this loan will be with a positive impact. 

Younis, through his increasing business income, will continue building his house. He hopes to stay upon his customers needs, and satisfy their desires.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools to increase his business.

loans.name: Afi Enyonamé

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 27ans. Elle est célibataire. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Afi travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois depuis 2006. Elle sert ses  clients  à dans un quartier de la place. Elle achète les produits au méme lieu. 
Afi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et des ignames.
texts.en: Afi is a 27 year-old single mother of two. She has sold charcoal for a living since 2006, and serves her customers from the same local quarter from which she buys her goods. She is seeking her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase bags of charcoal and yams.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and yams

loans.name: Silvia Raquel

texts.es: Silvia Raquel vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en una localidad muy concurrida de personas, ella posee una tortillería en su residencia y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues Silvia despacha las tortillas rápido y muy calientitas al gusto del cliente, además que tienen un buen precio y el lugar de venta es muy higiénico; Silvia Raquel es una mujer muy inteligente y siempre esta adelante de la competencia su clave para el éxito es la persistencia y dedicación en el trabajo quiere que el negocio crezca es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor y así adquirirlo a menor precio del que actualmente le ofrecen y con la finalidad de que ello le genere mayor ganancia. Silvia Raquel tiene fe que su trabajo le dará la oportunidad de darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Silvia Raquel lives with her life partner and their children in a busy town that is full of people. She has a tortilla shop in her home and lately she has received many customers. As a result, Silvia has had to produce hot tortillas quickly in order to keep her customers happy. In addition, she offers very good prices and keeps her premises spotlessly clean.

Silvia Raquel is a very intelligent woman who is always staying ahead of the competition. The key to her success is her persistence and dedication to her work. Silvia Raquel wants her business to grow, so she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy corn in bulk at a price that is lower that what is currently offered, which will help her generate more income. She has faith that her work will provide her family the opportunity to have a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is 40 years old and single.  She supports her parents.  She runs a retail shop and has been in this business for a period of eight years, making a monthly profit of KES 5,000.  This is her first loan from KADET Ltd.  She has been loaned KES 20,000, which she plans to use to buy sugar, cooking flour, maize, beans, rice, etc.  She will use the anticipated profit to invest in assets like tractors, land, computers and to pay school fees.  She hopes for a better future.

loans.use: buy sugar, flour, maize, beans, rice

loans.name: Pamela Ines

texts.es: La señora Pamela es socia integrante del banco de emprendimiento "las triunfadoras" pero esta vez solicito un credito individual, tiene como actividad la venta de cd`s, dvd`s un su kiosco ubicado por la zona gran poder una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de la Paz y solicito un crédito para la compra de lcd  40 pulgadas compra de colecciones de dvd`s por mayor para su segundo puesto de venta y así incrementar su capital de trabajo asimismo tener segura la mercadería de sus kioscos. Vive con su hijo, en la casa de sus papas, ella ayuda con los gastos familiares a sus papas, es una persona joven y muy responsable con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Pamela is a member of the 'Las Triunfadoras' community bank but, on this occasion, she is requesting an individual loan.  Her business is selling CDs and DVDs from a kiosk which is located in Gran Poder district.  This is a very busy area in the city of La Paz.  She requested this loan to buy a 40 inch LCD and some DVDs wholesale for her second sales kiosk.  In this way, she hopes to increase her working capital and have available the merchandise she needs for her kiosks.  Pamela lives with her son in her parents' home.  She helps her mom and dad with the family expenses.  Pamela is a very responsible young person who would like to improve her whole family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a 40 inch LCD and DVDs wholesale

loans.name: Edalyn

texts.en:
Edalyn is 31 years old and single. She works hard running a sari-sari  (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Edalyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Edalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья берет кредит на покупку спортивных костюмов к осени и зиме. Погода похоладала и нужно срочно завезти теплый товар. У натальи по-прежнему две торговые точки, которые удобно расположены и привлекают новых клиентов.
Наталья проживает с мужем и двумя дочками в 2-х комнатной квартире, условия проживания хорошие, семья дружная.
texts.en: Nataliya is taking out the loan to purchase sports suits for the autumn and winter. The weather is now colder and she needs to stock up on warm merchandise as soon as possible. Nataliya still has two vendor locations which are conveniently located and attract new customers. Nataliya lives with her husband and two daughters in a two bedroom apartment, the living conditions are good and her family is friendly.

loans.use: to purchase warm sports suits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his fishing business by buying new boat.

loans.name: Dushekan's Group

texts.en:
Dushekan is the leader of this group. She is 55 and unfortunately she is a widow. This brave woman has raised five daughters. The youngest daughter studies at school and all the other daughters are married and live with their families. Four years ago, Dushekan’s daughters presented her two farm animals and since that moment Dushekan has been engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from this loan she wants to increase the number of cattle she breeds. In the near future she plans to start repairing her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Blanca Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene 35 años D. edad, es casada con dos hijos.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, desD. la edad D. 15 años comenzó a trabajar en la compra y venta D. cerdos, esta actividad la heredo D. sus padres. Antes Blanca solo se ocupaba D. los oficios del hogar, pero decidió ayudar con los gastos del hogar, por medio D. la comercialización D. cerdos, el cual es muy rentable.
Blanca camina a pie durante veinticinco minutos, luego aborda un  autobús por una hora, hasta llegar al lugar donD. compra los cerdos para llevarlos a su casa y engordarlos para la venta.   
La señora Blanca, solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar dos cerdos y dos sacos D. concentrado para alimentarlos, y venderlos en la zona urbana ya que es rentable su venta. Ella actualmente no tiene cerdos, por que no cuenta con el capital para comprarlos. Con el ingreso que reciba Blanca apoyara a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. También Blanca desea construir una galera para  tener ahí sus cerdos y ayudar a su hijo para que estudie el bachillerato.
texts.en:
Blanca is 35 years old and she is married with two children. She is a very enterprising woman, since she was 15 years old she has worked in the buying and selling of pigs, which was her parents' traD.. 

Previously, Blanca just occupied herself with the household tasks, but she decided to help with the household expenses by trading pigs, which is very profitable. Blanca travels on foot for twenty-five minutes, then by bus for an hour, to get to the place where she buys the pigs so she can take them home and fatten them up to ready them for sale. 

Blanca is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo so she can buy two pigs and two bags of feed for them, and then sell them in the urban area where their sale is very profitable. At the moment she doesn't have any pigs because she doesn't have the capital to buy them. Blanca will use the income to help her husband with the household expenses. She also wants to build a pen for her pigs and to help her son so that he can gain a high school education.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and two bags of feed for them.

loans.name: Municipal D-4 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUNICIPAL D-4” iniciará su dos ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Julia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cereales, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, comercio de papa y arroz, elaboración de calzados, librería, costura.

La señora Julia,  indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta y elaboración de comida que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de viveres) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Municipal D-4” communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes focal center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Julia.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses among which we have: cereal sales, cosmetics sales, food sales, blanket weaving, potato and rice sales, shoe making, stationery shop and sewing.

Julia states that she’s worked with Pro Mujer for two years having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the promoters.  She currently has a business preparing food that she’s had for several years having learned it from her mother.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy foodstuffs in La Ceja which she’ll later sell in her food stand.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she’s married and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed and more agricultural products to resell.

loans.name: Matilde Mariela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a Matilde, tiene 32 años de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres, ella estudia Ciencias en la Educación en una Universidad de Manta. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y responsable.

Ella además de sus estudios también se dedica al comercio, tiene un negocio de venta de materiales de pesca, en su local sus clientes encuentran de todo desde  redes, anzuelos, piolas hasta combustibles y aceites en si todo lo necesario  para realizar una buena faena en alta mar, trabaja todos los días ya que todos los días llegan embarcaciones hasta este lugar, ella compra en Manta sus productos, tiene este negocio por 6 años y  le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, entre otros productos necesarios para la pesca.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Mar Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by national and foreign tourists.  Most of the residents here fish or otherwise work in the water for a living.

This is where we met Matilde.  She is 32 years old, single, and lives at home with her parents.  She is studying education science at the Universidad de Manta.  She has been with the communal bank since its inception; she is the treasurer and she likes it because the group is very close and responsible.

Aside from her studies, she also has a business selling fishing supplies.  In her shop, her customers can get everything from nets, hooks, and cord to fuel and oils--in other words, everything needed to work in high seas.  She works every day since boats arrive every day.  She buys her products in Manta.  She has had this business for six years and it has been going well for her.

This loan is to buy nets, hooks, and cord, among other products needed for fishing. 

Her dreams are to finish her studies and to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy nets, cord, hooks, and other fishing products.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 26 years old. She sells beer and sodas and she has been running this business for the past 4 years. She wants the loan to increase the inventory in her pub. With the profits, she wants to reinvest in the business. She would like to become the sole distributor of the drinks in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso de 39 años hace 17 años convive con Rosa, su incondicional pareja, con quien tiene a sus 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 6 años. Toda esta familia habita un hogar propio en la Comunidad Nativa de Pachacutec, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Alfonso es un hombre ejemplar. Con su trabajo dedicado en la agricultura ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, y brindarles una educación digna a sus 3 hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y por quienes trabaja.
Desde niño aprendió a labrar la tierra y negociar los productos que le otorga la naturaleza. En los montes de su comunidad cuenta con 3 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos, en los que produce café.
“La cosecha es buena en mayo y junio por que el precio del café sube hasta 14 soles la lata”, comenta.
Alfonso está contento con sus resultados, de las 3 parcelas obtiene como 15 sacos de café de 60 kilos cada uno aproximadamente.
A la vez, cuenta con un pequeño negocio de comestibles y golosinas instalado en su casa. Ahí Rosa se encarga de atender a los clientes, mientras prepara los alimentos de sus hijos. Está familia es unida, a pesar de las muchas tareas del hogar, Rosa y Alfonso se turnan para trabajar la tierra, ya que necesita atenciones constantes.
Alfonso quiere ampliar su negocio en una bodega donde expenderá abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Alfonso obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionado por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, del que se muestra esperanzado.
De adquirir el crédito, podrá comprar 5 bolsas de abonos orgánicos con 600 soles. Y lo restante será para ampliar su negocio con la compra de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 39, and has been living with Rosa, his life partner, for 17 years. They have three children, ages 15, 11, and 6. The whole family lives in their own home in the native community of Pachacutec, in Chanchamayo province. 

Alfonso is an exemplary man. Through his dedicated work as a farmer, he has been able to raise his family, and provide a decent education to his three children, whom he really loves, and for whom he works. 

Since he was a child, he learned to work the land, and sell the products that nature grants him. In the hills near his community he has three parcels of agricultural land, on which he grows coffee. 

"The harvest is good in May and June because the price of coffee goes up to 14 soles a can," he says. Alfonso is happy about his results. From the three parcels he gets around 15 sacks of coffee, each one approximately 60 kilos. 

At the same time he has a small business selling foodstuffs and candy set up in his house. There, Rosa is responsible for serving the customers, while she prepares food for her children. This is a close-knit family. In spite of the many household chores, Rosa and Alfonso take turns working the land, as it needs constant care.

Alfonso wants to expand his business into a small store where he will sell groceries and basic staples. This would be the first loan that Alfonso would obtain from MFP. He feels excited about that. Now he is part of the "Los Claveles de Pachacutec" communal bank, which he is hopeful about. 

When he gets the loan, he will be able to buy five bags of organic fertilizer with 600 soles. The rest will be for expanding his business through the purchase of merchandise.

loans.use: To buy five bags of fertilizer, and products for his business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 45-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from seven years to 21 years. He describes himself as honest, God fearing, and innovative. He operates a car and provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located at a murram road, and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits for a new grocery store. Moses's business goal is to own many cars to increase his modes of transportation within five years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for a new grocery store.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a widow who has seven children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. She sells cloth, purses, shoes, and undergarments in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast). Aba has been actively involved in this business for about four years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Aba will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of cloth and other products, thus aiding her to improve overall sales. Aba plans to use the new profits from her expanded business to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cloth and other products to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anastasie Fifongnon's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, nommée Anastasie Fifongnon (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 39 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture, activité qu'elle exerce depuis sept ans. Anastasie Fifongnon ne vit plus avec son mari. Le couple a un enfant, qui n'est pas encore scolarisé et qui est encore a leur charge. Anastasie Fifongnon vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Anastasie Fifongnon parallèlement à son activité vend des tissus par la technique de distribution. Anastasie Fifongnon s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Anastasie Fifongnon ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour la première  fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus.

loans.name: Fibetado Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIBETADO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Anne-Marie, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 46  ans est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Julien. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certain scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Anne-Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Anne-Marie n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Anne-Marie du riz et e l'huile d'arachide à son domicile depuis seize ans. Anne-Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Anne-Marie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIBETADO un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et de l'huile d'arachide.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. She is married with four children.She is a hard working enterprenuer. Aida has a buy and sell pig business in the Philippines.

Aida requested a PHP 7,000 loan through GDMPC to buy more pigs to sell.She has been in the business for ten years.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money to expand her business and to educate their children for the future.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restock the restaurant and buy a new bicycle for transport.

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.en:
Sharafat provides for her family by selling milk. She wishes to increase her income. She has 10 years of experience in this business. Sharafat plans to expand the dairy farming for increasing the milk. In the beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $600 and bought a cow. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 milking cows.
Sharafat was born in Salyan region Khaladj village, is married, and has 3 children.

loans.use: To buy 2 milking cows

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married and has one daughter. Her husband works as a baker. Eva began working seventeen years ago making suits for men and women. Her mother sent her to an arts college and when she finished college she was given a sewing machine. From a very young age, she loved to sew. Therefore, Eva decided that she would continue with this line of work when she got older. Her customers come to her because she provides both quality and low prices. Eva and her husband take turns going to wholesalers to purchase things like fabric, thread, and utensils.

Eva is on her second loan with Mifex. Her first loan went well as she was able to invest in buttons and fabrics. She and her husband have recently moved to a slightly better area where there is less crime and businesses have better opportunities of flourishing. She is hoping that this loan will help her build a new workshop.

loans.use: to build a workshop in her home

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 39 years old and has 6 children.  She lives in an urban area of Benin City, Edo State Nigeria.  She sells food & provisions and needs the above loan to expand her business.  She believes that LAPO has helped her business expand to a greater height.

loans.use: To buy more provision & food stuff

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria Cortéz Arias is single. She is a member of the Korikantutitas Association in Villa Tejada, in the city of El Alto. Her business is making doll clothes, miniature clothing, and other artesanal products which she sells at national markets for miniatures. She worked in this field for over 15 years. She strives to support herself with this business, selling to small merchants by the dozen. She has a kiosk on Graneros Street in La Paz where she also sells her products in bulk. At present, she works with a partner who helps make the necessary trips to miniature fairs throughout the country. She needs capital to increase her merchandise. In this way, she can improve her sales and thereby her income.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria Cortéz Arias, soltera , es miembro de la asociación Korikantutitas de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto, su principal actividad es la confección de prendas de vestir en miniatura, ropa de muñeca y otras artesanías, que vende en todas las ferias de miniatura a nivel nacional. Son más de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad, Victoria intenta sobrevivir con este negocio, vendiendo siempre por docena a aquellos comerciantes minoristas. Ella posee un puesto de venta en la calle Graneros de la ciudad de La Paz, donde de igual manera vende sus trabajos al por mayor. En la actualidad, Victoria trabaja con una socia, la que le colabora principalmente a realizar los viajes necesarios a las ferias de miniatura en todo el interior del país. Ella precisa de capital para poder incrementar su mercadería, de esta manera mejorar su venta y principalmente sus ingresos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Kubri Fonka

texts.en: V. is the mother of five children, all of whom are in school. Paying their school fees is a big challenge, but she is determined to do it to secure a better life for all of them. Because she and her husband are not able to pay these fees on his salary, V. has come to us for a loan to start her own business. She will use her loan to buy, cook and sell food to the people of her village, and also buy firewood to sell to her customers. She will use her income to pay school fees and find a bigger house to live in, because today she and her family live in a small house with only two rooms.

loans.use: Purchase of food and firewood

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana is a member of the bank, “Banco Comunal Señor del Cautivo II”. She sells lingerie and started her business 6 years ago in the city of Huaraz with her husband.

With this loan of 1,300 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she’ll be able to get her business ready for the Christmas holidays. She’ll buy 12 dozen floral decorations for Christmas and 15 dozen Christmas presents.

Her wish is to grow her business. Two months ago she opened a telephone business that her husband administers.

Ana is a married, 47 year old with no children. The income she makes allows her to cover the costs of living, like for example, the cost of renting her house and her sales kiosks.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor del Cautivo II, se dedica a la venta de lencería, hace 6 años inicio su negocio en la ciudad de Huaraz conjuntamente con su esposo.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, podrá surtir su negocio para las fiestas navideñas, comprará 12 docenas de adornos florales para esta Navidad y 15 docenas de regalos navideños.

Su deseo es crecer cada vez mas, hace dos meses ha aperturado un locutorio para que su esposo lo administre.

La señora Ana tiene 47 años de edad y está casada, no tiene hijos; sus ingresos le permite satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, como por ejemplo el alquiler de su casa y alquiler de sus puestos de venta.

loans.use: To buy floral decorations. To buy Christmas presents.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes belongs to the Virgen de la Natividad communal bank, situated in Jr. Gonzáles Prada Nº 148 in the Callería district in Ucayali. She is 50 years old, and is the mother of a teenage son. Her husband is a chauffeur. Mercedes, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300, decided to invest in a small grocery store.

She currently runs her own grocery store. Mercedes wakes up at 6 a.m. to go to the market, prepare breakfast for her son and husband, and then open up her store and tend to her clients.

With the loan of S/. 2,000, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase 10 cases of soda pop, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 package of oil, 1 case of milk, 1 package of noodles, 2 boxes of eggs, etc.

Mercedes is very happy because the business has been going well ever since she started, and she is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for being a great help for her inversion and the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en Jr. Gonzáles Prada Nº 148, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años y es madre de un hijo adolescente, su esposo es chofer. Mercedes con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega. Mercedes se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. para ir al mercado, preparar el desayuno de su hijo y su esposo y luego abrir su bodega para la atención de sus clientes.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 10 cajas de gaseosas, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de aceite, 1 caja de leche, 1 paquete de fideos, 2 cajas de huevos, etc.

Mercedes está muy feliz porque desde que empezó con el negocio le va muy bien, y además está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos porque es una gran ayuda para su inversión y para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase groceries (soda pop, rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.)

loans.name: Luzinga East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hanifah N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Hanifah is 29 years old and is married to her husband, who is a teacher. She has 2 children, aged 2 to 5, and only one goes to school. Each week, Hanifah makes approximately UGX 36000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to improve her business. Hanifah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hanifah is joined in her small group by Phoebe Mwebazap, Jennifer K. and Juliet N.. Phoebe Mwebaza has a business in retail shop and wants to add in capital. Jennifer K. is currently operating a business in selling maize and wants a loan to boost business. Juliet N. operates a business of selling new clothes and wants to expand business.

loans.use: To expand retail shop business by adding more stock

loans.name: Amelia's Group

texts.es:
Amelia, Raquel, and Juanita are members of the "Amauta Huamanga Community Bank" since 10, 5, and 13 years, respectively.

Amelia is 45 years old; she is married and has three children. She is a street vendor and sells fruit at the train and bus terminals of her city.

Raquel is 41 years old and she is single. She runs a small shop where she sells an assortment of goods including vegetables, clothing, and jewelry.

Juanita is 48 years old; she is married and has eight children. Together with her husband, she runs an autobody repair shop. Juanita used to be a street vendor and she would use the loan to return to this line of work.

Amelia, Raquel, and Juanita are asking for loans of 300, 1000, and 300 soles, respectively. They will use them to buy grapes, oranges, sugar, soft drinks, rice, and other goods.

The dream of all three women is to have children who will enter a profession. They also want to improve their businesses and reach their objectives.

loans.use: To buy grapes, oranges, sugar, soft drinks, rice and other goods

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 48 years old and married with two children. Her children are 20 and 15 years old. Mwanahawa is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2005. She works from 7am to 6pm at her business every day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly belongs to the Mujeres Soñadoras community bank, located at Jirón Guillermo Sisley 781, in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and the mother of 5 children, and she is separated. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Nelly decided to invest in a small business selling soft drinks.

She currently has a storefront in her own home from where she offers soft drinks, allowing her to take care of her domestic duties as well as the business. Her children take turns helping out, as they are still in school, and everything Nelly does is to give them best she can.

With a loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: soft drinks, candies, gelatins and mineral water.

Nelly says that since she began to work with Manuela Ramos her life has changed. Now she feels more secure, optimistic, and is very grateful to all the women who work at Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Soñadoras, ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley 781, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, es separada. Nelly con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta D. gaseosas.

En la actualidad tiene un local para que ofrezca sus gaseosas en su propia casa, comparte sus tareas domesticas con la atención D. su negocio, sus hijos la ayudan y se turnan por estudian aun en el colegio, todo lo que hace Nelly es por darles lo mejor a ellos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas, golosinas, gelatina, agua mineral.

Nelly nos cuenta que desD. que empezó a trabajar con lo préstamos su vida ha cambiado ahora se siente mas segura, optimista, y esta muy agradecida a todas las mujeres que trabajan en Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua A. is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She is a petty trader who sells items like rice, tin tomatoes, onions, cooking oil, pepper, canned foods, evaporated milk, soaps, etc. on a table in her neighborhood. She is very grateful for her previous loan, which provided her with working capital. At the moment, two of the children have completed senior high school and are ready to enter university this year. Akua is determined to work harder to give her husband the needed financial assistance to support the children in school. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of rice, sugar, beans, evaporated milk, soaps and also to include the sale of charcoal. Akua believes this will help raise enough income to finance her children's education. She is a member of the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group and she was photographed at her group meeting. In this group, members serve as social collateral to access loans and to apply a little peer pressure as encouragement and support to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy additional rice, sugar, beans, evaporated milk, soap and charcoal.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent is a 32 year old married mother of 4 children. She lives with her family in Nyalenda Kisumu, Kenya. She runs a retail shop where she sells fast-moving commodities such as sugar, milk, soap, kerosene, rice, and flour. She has received three microfinance loans from KMET/ Kiva and has repaid them all. She currently requestsUS $800 to buy more stock.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Add more stock to her business.

loans.name: Matha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is Matha W. from Dar es Salaam. She has two adult children and also cares for two teenage children who board with her because they have come from a different part of the country to study in Dar’s schools.

Matha owns a taxi business. She owns a car in which her sole employee drives customers to their desired destinations. Matha currently earns US$ 75 from her business and is requesting a loan of US$ 275 that she intends to put towards the repair and maintenance of her car. She hopes that this will allow her to rent out her car for more hours each day and therefore earn increased profits.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To perform much needed maintenance on her taxi

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein K. is 36 years old, single, and lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He owns a small shop where he sells "nargileh," the traditional and very popular Lebanese water pipe used for smoking tobacco, or "sheesha," of various flavors.

Hussein is asking for a US$ 700 loan in order to purchase new nargileh and various accessories for his store. This is the first time Hussein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new stock of "Nargileh" for his store

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun C., 50 years old, and her husband, Mr. Song Sorn, 50 years old, live on an Island near the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. This couple was married in 1979 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. Two sons are security guards while the two daughters are silk weavers and the other daughter is a salesperson.

Mrs. Savoeun has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. Silk weaving is a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Song is a chef and regularly cooks for weddings and other ceremonies in the village.

Savoeun is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Las Carmelitas Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Las Carmelitas, esta ubicado en Huancavelica, que es una zona de extrema pobreza. El bancomunal tiene 10 socias.

Oscar C., es casado, tiene 4 hijos, su negocio es una tienda surtida de abarrotes, manifiesta que en las reuniones de su bancomunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, su sueño es incrementar mas productos en su bodega para poder asegurar a su familia.

Nora A., es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos entre 21 y 4 años, vende bistec y fritanga en las ferias, ahora esta muy preocupada pues la han desalojado de su casa (alquilada), esta en búsqueda de un lugar para vivir junto a sus hijos. Nora desea comprar un balon de gas pequeño para poder trasladar su negocio a diferentes lugares, y vender en diversas ferias.

Esther P., es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 8 años y otro de 5 meses, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, muy temprano compra leña, cargando a su bebita en la espalda va vendiendo entre ferias, tambien en ocasiones lava ropa.
texts.en:
The community bank, "The Small Candies," is located in Huancavelica, which is an area of extreme poverty. The community bank has 10 members. Oscar C. is married with 4 children. His business is a store stocked with groceries. He has shown in the community bank meetings that he has learned to save. His dream is to increase the offerings of this store so that he can provide for his family. Nora A. is a single mother with 4 children between 4 and 21 years old. She sells meat and fried food at fairs Now she is very worried because she has been evicted from her rented house, and is looking for a place to live with her children. Nora would like to purchase a small cylinder of gas so that she can move her business to different places and sell in many fairs. Esther Palominio is married with two children, 8 years old and 5 months old. She sells kabobs. Very early in the day she purchases wood, and goes to sell her kabobs at the fairs while carrying her baby on her back. Also, she sometimes washes cloths.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the businesses of 10 Community Bank members

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de pantalones de Jeans que los acomoda a crédito en los mercados de la zona de el cementerio de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive en la zona de El Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus padres. 
Es soltera y la única que genera ingresos para sus gastos personales y familiares ya que es independiente.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, las ganas de superarse e incrementar sus ingresos de dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería ( Ropa y jeans).
texts.en:
Maria is a businesswoman selling Jeans pants on credit in the markets of the cemetery district of the city of La Paz. She lives in the El Tejar district of La Paz in her parents' home. She is single and has earned her own income for her personal and family expenses since she became independent. This is the first time she has requested credit, the desire to improve herself and increase her income giving her the opportunity to access this loan. The funds will be for the purchase of merchandise (clothing and jeans).

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 48 años, vive con su pareja y su hija mayor de edad. Desde que se casó viene practicando las labores de un agricultora y comerciante, ya que sus productos los llevan a vender a la capital del país para generar mayores ganancias, hace 10 años inició su propio cultivo y le va muy bien, ya que quincenalmente viaja a Lima. De la misma forma, está pensando iniciar un negocio  complementario al suyo, pero ligado a la producción, ya que es lo que más le agrada realizar. Sin embargo, lo tedioso dentro de la agricultura, es regar los terrenos  para tener las tierras altamente productivas que le generen ganancias, más no pérdidas. Rosa se encuentra en su 2do crédito con MFP, y hasta el momento ha sido muy cumplida  y responsable  con sus pagos. Para cultivar otros productos agrícolas requiere de abonos y fertilizantes, por lo que solicita la cantidad referida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and her grown daughter. Ever since she married, she has been working as a farmer and a salesperson. She takes her wares to the country's capital in order to get better profits. Ten years ago she started her own farm; it's going very well, and every two weeks she travels to Lima. Likewise, she is thinking of starting a business complementary to her existing one, but connected to production, which is more to her liking. Nevertheless, the tedious thing about farming is irrigating the land so that it will be most productive and yield the best profit, not losses. This is Rosa's second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and so far she has been very responsible in making payments. To farm other products, she needs fertilizer, and she is requesting the loan for that.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Mrs. Elvie P., married with 5 children, is 40 years of age and a resident of Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. They have a little fishing business from which they earn a meagre income. What challenges Elvie is living with a big family to feed. It's exhausting managing their business well, and she and her husband work in tandem to sell their catch at the nearest market. Sometimes, wholesale buyers from other towns and cities come to buy their fish. They want to save enough for their children's studies. They are assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital.

Full of hope, Elvie wants to expand her business. She wants to sustain it as this is their only means of income.

loans.use: Capital for fishing

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en: Ganna sells women's clothing at the city market. She has been in this business 7 years. She knows and runs it well. Ganna and her husband Mykola lost their only daughter in a car accident. Though it was very difficult for them to go on after this event, they made it and continued to live and run the business. Now Ganna wants to continue her business and develop it further. Ganna would like to receive a loan of 6,500 UAH to increase her inventories.

loans.use: to increase her inventories to sell.

loans.name: Tofik

texts.en: Tofik is 47 years old. He lives in the town of Khachmaz. He is married and has three children. Five years ago, he started a cattle breeding business. Now, he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy five calves for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy five calves

loans.name: Bassira

texts.fr: Bassira L. est un vigile qui habite aux Parcelles assainis de Thiès.   Il est célibataire mais il vit avec ses parents.
