Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter du ciment et du sable pour la réfection de leur maison et aussi d’acheter des poussins et des aliments pour son agriculture.  Monsieur L. a déjà reçu deux crédits auprès de l’IMCEC et il les a bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Bassira L. is a security guard who lives in the Parcelles Assainis of Thiès. He is unmarried but lives with his parents. He’s requesting this loan to buy cement and sand for repairing their house and also to buy chicks and feed for his farming. He has already received two loans before from IMCEC, and he repaid them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing his house

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka has been a clothes, shoes and handbag seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to the Sitaki shari group loan (Group code 2045). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business from 6:00am to 10:00pm.  

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more shoes, handbags and bed sheets for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Mwaka is 34 years old and single.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, handbags and bed sheets for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
A furniture business is the source of income for Jane A. and her husband. Jane is 47 years old and married to Ruben A.. They live happily and peacefully in the village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. The couple is always dreaming of having a good and comfortable life. According to them, “poverty is not the reason for not achieving their dreams, poverty is only a challenge for them to move forward and follow their dreams.”

The couple strives hard and sacrifices a lot to make their business sustainable and more productive. But their income is not enough to maintain their business and to provide for all their needs. Thus, Jane asked for financial assistance from ASKI to improve and expand their business. She is requesting a loan of PHP20,000.00 to buy more wood and other materials to make more furniture, be able to sell more to their customers, and thus increase their income. The loan will be a big help to their business expansion and make it more profitable. They believe that through their patience, they can achieve their dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy more wood and other materials for their furniture business.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey N., 38, lives in Kampong Chhnang Province where she earns her living growing rice and vegetable crops on her own farmland. She takes 3 months to grow those crops and then she sells them when they are mature, earning on average US$ 2 a day. She has been growing them for over ten years now, so she has a lot of experience.

Mey N. is married and has six children, two of whom are employed: one is a garment worker and the other one works as a dealer in a casino. Her husband, Somnang, age 41, is a generator repairer. The family has been building their house for a long time but the construction is still not completed. Therefore, Mey N. has decided to request a loan on Kiva in order to use it to finish building their house.

loans.use: To finish building their house

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en: Edmar O. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 37 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Edmar owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Edmar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Edmar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his fourth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and to pay for his children's education. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos; Joseph de 13, Juliano de 10 y  Catherine de 4 años. Heredó de su padre varios terrenos cultivables y desde que se casó trabaja con su esposo sembrado papas, arvejas y maíz.  Pero lo que más le agrada son las arvejas por ser de menor inversión y la tierra rinde para tres cosechas, por ello cuida de sus planta diariamente para detectar el acecho de los mosquitos u otras plagas. Si es así, fumiga las hojas hasta que afloren y logren fructificar de manera uniforme para luego proceder a la recolección. A Mercedes le gusta trabajar en la chacra, a la que estima mucho por brindarle sus buenos frutos, que gracias a ellos pudo construir su casa y ahora está dedicada a los acabados para lograr vivir cómodamente con sus hijos. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, en los préstamos anteriores demostró puntualidad en cada una de sus cuotas. Además, durante los últimos 5 ciclos consecutivos viene siendo la tesorera de su banco comunal y como es muy eficiente en su cargo, sus compañeros la animan a que continúe el siguiente ciclo. Con el dinero solicitado comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja del tipo utrillo, por ser sus frutos de mejor tamaño.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 42 years old, married, and has three children: Joseph who is 13, Juliano who is 10, and Catherine who is 4 years old. She inherited several plots of land from her father and since she married, has worked with her husband growing potatoes, peas, and corn. She likes the peas best because they take the least work and provide enough for three harvests. She takes care of her plants each day looking for evidence of mosquitoes or other pests. If she finds pests, she fumigates the leaves until they have grown and flowered in a uniform way so she can then relocate them. Mercedes likes to work on her plot of land and is proud of it for producing well. Thanks to its production, they have been able to build a house and are now putting on the final additions so they can live comfortably with their children. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She has proven herself punctual with her payments on her former loans. In addition, she has been the treasurer for her communal bank for the past five cycles. She is very efficient and her fellow members want her to continue being treasurer. With the money she is asking for, she will buy a bag of seeds for a specific type of seed the will produce a bigger pea.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de semilla de arverja

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Назире – 46 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на рынка «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда, а также на рынке "Саховат" и по воскресеньям на рынке "Якшанбебазар" города Худжанда. Назира закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан и часть товара из города Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Она ездит за товаром 2-3 раза в месяц. Назира кредитуется у нас с 2002 года. Она очень хороший и давний наш клиент. Назира просит кредит для закупки новой партии летнего детской одежды их хлопчатобумажной ткани. Тогда у Назиры увеличится ассортимент ее товара и у нее увеличится количество клиентов.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Nazira is 46 years old, she is married and is a mother of two children. She has high education. She sells children's clothing. She sells on the Panschabe market in the town of Khujand and also on the Sahovat market as well as on the Yakwanbebazar market on Sundays in Khujand. She travels for the merchandise two to three times a month. Nazira has been borrowing from us since 2002. She is our very good and old client. Nazira is asking for a loan to buy a new batch of summer children's clothing made from cotton. This way Nazira's assortment will increase and she will have more customers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer children's clothing

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
25-year-old Rosalie M. is a rice grower from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She has one child and her only wish is that she could own a farm so that they could provide better for all their family needs. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer, rice seeds, and gallons of chemicals. She has a strong feeling that that by buying all of these things, she will be able to increase the size of their harvest.

Now, she is connected with the CEVI credit program. She has received not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en:
Tsogtbayar T. lives with his wife and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest child currently attends elementary school and his youngest two children have not yet reached school age. 

Tsogtbayar sells shoes in his hometown with the help of his wife. He sells shoes from a rented stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in the city. Tsogtbayar started his business in 2004 and has gained much experience as a businessman. He has excelled as a good salesman. 

Tsogtbayar attributes the success of his business to his hardworking attitude and good business sense. For the future he says ''I want to improve and expand my business so that I can build a house for my family.''  He is requesting a 2 million tugrug  (~ $1400 USD) loan to purchase supplies and expand his business..

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and expand his business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es: Mabel tiene 36 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos: Sandra de 17 y André de 5, en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir y otros similares, en el taller que instaló en su casa, donde trabaja con dos personas para cubrir los pedidos que le realizan, ya que sola no se daba abasto. Pero Mabel no sólo tiene la labor de confeccionar las prendas, sino también de adquirir el material y para eso debe viajar desde su distrito hasta el centro de la ciudad, en 2 horas de recorrido. Sin embargo y felizmente, Mabel ha sabido amoldarse a su trabajo y le gusta mucho realizarlo, ya que le da las posibilidades de ser independiente y trabajar para ella misma, por eso le pone mucho empeño, pues en el futuro quiere que su taller sea mucho más grande y mejor implementado. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y promete ser muy responsable y puntual con todos los pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará grandes cantidades de tela, ya que actualmente tiene un pedido de fundas para almohadas.
texts.en:
Mabel is 36. She lives in her own house with her life partner and her children. Sandra is 17, and André is 5. For two years she has been making clothing and similar items in the shop she installed in her house. She works there with two people to fill the orders that they get. She could not do it alone. Mabel not only has the work of making the clothing, but she also gets the material. To do this she needs to travel from her district to the center of the city, which is a two hour trip. Nevertheless, Mabel has happily known how to adapt herself to her work. She really likes what she does. It gives her the chance to be independent and to work for herself. That is why she puts forth much effort. In the future she wants her shop to be much larger and better established. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to be very responsible and punctual with all of her payments. With the money she is asking for she will buy large quantities of fabric because she currently has an order for pillowcases.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Wafe

texts.en:
Wafe M. is currently in the business of breaking and selling stones and is requesting a loan to purchase more tools for breaking stones to sell.  

Wafe is 38 years old and is Widowed.   She has 5 children and her children go to school. 

 With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to employ some strong men to break stones in the quarying place.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more tools for breaking stones to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 27 years old and married with one child. He is a farmer in Majengo, Nairobi. He is requesting a loan of Kes 40,000 to open a kerosene business. Patrick hopes to own two Public Service Vehicles in ten years and to earn enough to buy his family a home. He describes himself as hardworking and development-conscious. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy kerosene to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo (Joaquín), de 42 años, y con sus 2 hijos: Edileth de 6 y Adriana de 2 años de edad, en su casa propia.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de gorras y lentes para el sol, actividad a cual le pone todas sus energías, ya que desde tempranas horas sale de su humilde y lejana casa transportando su mercadería para llevarla hasta uno de los mercados más concurridos del distrito donde vive. Ella realiza la venta de forma ambulatoria y así logra los ingresos necesarios para el sustento y los gastos de su familia. A Virginia le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le permite tener libertad sobre sus horarios y poder distribuirlo entre sus hijas y el trabajo en su hogar, aunque algunas veces le resulta muy cansado, ya que su trabajo es de lunes a domingo. Felizmente las ventas con buenas y Virginia espera seguir creciendo y progresando en esta actividad, para que en un futuro pueda tener un puesto propio en el mercado y así tener mayor estabilidad.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sabido responder muy bien en los pagos, al igual que su en banco comunal donde todas sus compañeras se esmeran en serlo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en lentes y gorras y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Virginia is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Joaquin (age 42) and their chidren, Edileth (age 6) and Adriana (age 2).

She has been selling caps and sunglasses for four years, an activity that requires all of her energy. In the early morning hours, Virginia carries her merchandise from her modest home to one of the busiest markets in their district. She works as a travelling merchant and her income enables her to pay for her family’s expenses. Virginia enjoys her work, which allows her the freedom to establish her own schedule and devote time to her children and her housework. Sometimes the job can be tiring because she works Monday through Sunday. Fortunately, sales have been good and Virginia expects her business will continue growing. In the future, she hopes to have her own vending post in the market and experience greater stability.

This is her third loan with MFP. Like the other members of her Communal Bank, Virginia has been very responsible with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to buy a large quantity of caps and sunglasses so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of caps & sunglasses

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, realiza labores de casa, su esposo es jubilado de la Aduana.
Vive en la zona de Villa San Antonio de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa en anticrético.
El crédito será destinado para Salud para pagar el costo de un tratamiento Médico completo que ella necesita.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su necesidad de poder hacer ese tratamiento le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Silvia does housework, and her husband is retired from Customs. She lives in the Villa San Antonio region of the city of La Paz in a house in “anticredito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). The loan is to pay for the cost of the complete medical treatment that she needs. This is the first time she has asked Impro for a loan. Her need to be able to have this treatment gives her the opportunity to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of complete medical treatment for her health

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 58 años, es viuda y vive con uno de su hijo en su casa propia.
Al quedarse viuda sufrió mucho, sobre todo en las siegas del café, porque es un trabajo muy duro; desde la recolección, hasta el transporte de los sacos pesados. Pero ahora que creció su hijo vienen lidiando juntos con este trabajo. A diario madruga, levantándose a las 5 de la mañana, solo así se da tiempo para todas sus labores domesticas y para trabajar en sus chacras.
Manuela se ha dedicado toda su vida a las labores agrícolas y aprendió a trabajar con mucha y alegría con sus cultivos, con las expectativas de triunfar con ellos, pues como madre anhela que su hijo tenga una mejor educación.

Durante sus dos créditos anteriores no tuvo problemas de pago, y para este ciclo se compromete seguir la dinámica de trabajo en su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho cariño. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 58 year old widow. She lives with one of her children in her own house. She suffered a lot when she became a widow. She suffered the most with the coffee harvest. From collecting it to transporting it in the heavy sacks, it is very hard work. Now that her son has grown, they struggle together in this work. She gets up at five every morning. That is the only way that she has time for all of her domestic chores and to work in her fields. Manuela has devoted her whole life to the farming work. She has learned to work in her fields with much effort, happiness, and the expectations of triumph. As a mother, she longs for her son to have a better education. She did not have any problems paying the last two loans. For this cycle she promises to keep being dynamic in her work in her communal bank, for which has much affection. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Asante House Group

texts.en: Zenabu is 60 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. Her children are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The major occupation of the people is in the fishing industry. Zenabu is a food vendor. She is the leader of a trust bank group called A. House. The members of the group are mainly in the fishing industry and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Zenabu, the group leader, is second from the right in the photograph. It is the group's desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A. is from the village of Balanoy, Lapaz Tarlac. She is 33 years old. Arlene is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arlene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Arlene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou R., 56, is married and lives with his three childR. in Takeo Province, Cambodia. R. operates his motorbike as a taxi driver in Bati district, and is able to earn an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. He has been with this business since 1979. His wife is in the agriculture sector of growing rice and some types of crops, earning an income of USD 0.5 per day. R. and his wife try to work hard and help each others to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, R. is requesting for a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the expected loan to purchase recyclable materials for re-sale. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy recyclable material for re-sale

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas K. O. is forty-two years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a businesswoman and they hope to give their children a good education. His business is located at Brick point-Nyamasaria in Kisumu. The business is situated along the Kisumu-Nairobi highway.

Before opening up the retail shop, Thomas was selling herbal medicine and to date he treats people using herbal medicines. He has for the last ten years been selling foodstuffs and general household goods, and he has even created employment for three people. He serves the area residents, passers-by, and school-going children.

Thomas acknowledges that he needs more space to serve a larger market. However he is using his Kes 50,000 loan to grow his business by adding more stocks of wheat flour and beans. In future, he hopes to set up a big clinic to help the sick through herbal medicines. He is courageous, bold, and simple.

loans.use: wheat flour and beans

loans.name: William Andres

texts.es:
El Señor William Andrés N., labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene dos  hijos a su cargo y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales eléctricos como son alambres candelas y caja por lo que anteriormente sete se encontraba en mal estado por lo que ahora podrá contar con un mejor sistema eléctrico para su hogar. 

 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Francisco dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor William Andrés N. works as a janitor as the oriental market in Managua. He has two children who are of school age. He is married. He has had four loans with Ceprodel in three years. In this period of time, he has invested two loans in improving his home, thanks to the financing offered to him by Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. He will invest the requested loan in the purchase of electrical materials like an alarm, lights, and an electrical box because the ones he had previously were in bad shape. Now he will be able to have a better electrical system for his home. He is doing all of this with the objective of offering more safety and better living conditions to his children. Francisco said that the loans he has received have gone towards improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven de 27 años está casado con la señora Karina Villegas juntos tienen 2 hermosos hijos el menor apenas tiene 3 semanas, son muy responsables y dedicados a su trabajo.

Edwin y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de la maica central en la casa de sus padres, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteo, actualmente cuentan con 10 cabezas de ganado lechero, así como también Edwin trabaja en un taller de rectificador de motos.
El préstamo será destinado para la compra de forraje para su ganado, que ya actualmente esta temporada el costo de los insumos agrícolas se incrementa.

Entra sus sueños y metas es aumentar las cabezas de ganado lechero y de esta manera incrementar la producción de leche, uno de sus sueños más importantes es terminar de construir su casa, ya los padres le heredaron un terreno en la cual ya empezaron a construir y de esta manera ofrecerles una casa, en la cual cada uno de sus hijos puedan tener una habitación ya que actualmente viven muy incómodos en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Edwin, 27, is married to Karina Villegas; they have two beautiful children, the youngest of whom is just three weeks old. They are very responsible and dedicated to their work. Edwin and his family live in the city of Cochabamba in the Maica Central community, in his parents' house. His main activity is the production of raw milk which is delivered to a firm that produces dairy products. They currently have 10 head of dairy cattle. Edwin also works at a motorcycle repair shop. The funds will be used to buy forage for his cows because the price of farm supplies rises during this season. Among his dreams and goals is to increase the number of cows so that milk production will increase. One of his most important dreams is to finish building his house since his parents willed him a piece of property on which they already have begun to build in order to give him a house in which each of his children can have a bedroom; currently they are quite uncomfortable in their parents' house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La sra. Virginia trabaja desde el año 2007 con nuestra institución, ella tiene su restaurant ubicado en la zona de Villa Salome, tiene mucho tiempo en este rubro por lo que conoce bien acerca de esta actividad, su esposo tenía un salon de billar, pero lo vendió y abrieron otro restaurant en la zona de Pampahasi, al este de la ciudada de la paz 

En ambos locales les está yendo muy bien ya que son muy conocidos por la zona; tienen una pequeña hijita de 2 años y viven en la zona de Pampahasi (La zona de Pampahasi, ubicada en la ladera Este de la ciudad, es considerada como un barrio residencial y turístico. En los últimos nueve años alcanzó un desarrollo vertiginoso que se tradujo en mejores condiciones de vida para los aproximadamente 30.000 habitantes. 

Desde la entrada a la zona, el punto denominado segundo cruce, el límite con Villa San Antonio, se pueden advertir  imponentes edificaciones de hasta cuatro plantas, muchas de ellas con fachadas acabadas, como también calles y amplias avenidas asfaltadas, a lo que se suman las jardineras y los espacios de recreación.

La zona abarca 16 barrios en tres sectores: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (cancha Venus) y Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cervecería y La Guardia), aqui en la ciudad están los dos solos ya que sus familiares están en el campo,y van a visitarlos frecuentemente. El crédito que solicita ahora es para completar el saldo para tomar el local en anticrético y no pagar el alquiler cada mes. La Sra. Virginia es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginia has been a client of our institution since 2007. She owns a restaurant in the Villa Salome area, a business that she has operated for some time and knows well. Her husband used to own a pool hall but he sold it and opened another restaurant in Pampahasi, a suburb east of La Paz. Both businesses are thriving because they are well known in their respective areas. The couple has a 2 year old daughter and they live in Pampahasi. Pampahasi, on the eastern side of La Paz, is considered both a residential neighborhood and a tourist destination. In the last nine years, the town has grown enormously and conditions for its 30,000 inhabitants have improved, as well. From the edge of the town, at the Segundo Cruce bridge near the border with Villa San Antonio, you can see impressive buildings of up to four floors with finished facades, along paved streets and wide avenues, lined with green lawns and open areas. The town has 16 neighborhoods in three zones: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (Venus Fields) and Alto (Said-Crus Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cerveceria and La Guardia). It's here that the two live alone because their family is in the country. The loan that she is applying for will be used to buy the building where the restaurant operates (using a uniquely Bolivian form of property ownership). The purchase will allow her to avoid paying a monthly rent. Virginia is a responsible and hard-working person. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they've place in her by extending this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy building for restaurant business.

loans.name: Leona Lucia

texts.es: Leona es de 61 años de edad, tuvo cuatro hijo dos varones y dos mujeres todos ya están casados, ella es viuda y se dedica a tejer y vender cortes típicos en el mercado local, en ASDIR es el segundo crédito que solicita, el anterior lo pago con mucha responsabilidad, Doña leona es muy conocida como participativa y colaboradora en su población, a pesar de la edad tiene muchas energías y ganas de superar, necesita el financiamiento apara ampliar su capital de trabajo, específicamente la compra de hilo para su tejeduría.
texts.en:
Leona is 61 years old and she had 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls, all of whom are married now. She is a widow, dedicated to weaving typical clothing which she sells in the local market. This is the 2nd loan she has solicited with ASDIR. Her previous loan was repaid with much responsibility. Leona is well known for her participation and collaboration in her community. Despite her age, she has much energy and desire to achieve. She needs the financing to increase her working capital, and specifically, to buy thread for her artful weaving.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING THREAD FOR WEAVING TYPICAL CLOTHING WHICH SHE SELLS

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha I. is married and a small businesswoman. She sells cassava wholesale to customers. She purchases her goods directly from the farmers at Chanika ward in Dar es Salaam and sells to retail customers in various marketplaces for domestic and business purposes. The income generated by the business helps her to pay school fees, meet her family's daily demands and acquire business capital. She needs a loan of 700,000 TZS to boost the business.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Buena Vida 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Debora is the coordinator of her group La Buena Vida (The Good Life), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her husband.

Debora is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling purses by purchasing them in the main markets in Santo Domingo and then selling them at a profit. She will use the profits to invest in first repairing her current home and then saving towards purchasing her own own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy purses to sell.

loans.name: Diompelor Group

texts.en:
Clara A., holding the sign, is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Diompelor. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children, one and 8. She did not have the opportunity to go to college due to lack of financial support. Clara has been selling soft drinks on the street at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia, for the past eight years. She gives her customers good service, which keeps them returning but faces problems with the scarcity of goods in the market.

Clara started selling with funds from her husband. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 44,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more soft drinks to continue her business. Her goal is to build a house for her family so they can live a better life. She describes herself as a bright and good business woman.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Fiend

texts.en:
Fiend is 40 years old and is still single. He owns a shop where he sells a variety of goods such as cosmetics goods and some other goods which are indicated by his photo. He has been in this business for about a year and his shop is open from the morning hours until late in the evening.

Fiend, after realizing that his capital is too low an amount to earn more profits, would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his capital. With this increased capital, he hopes that his sales, as well as his profits, will increase and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods for his store such as cooking oil, sugar, rice, different types of flour, beans, peas, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her twin brother's children. Sarah owns a cosmetics shop selling all types of cosmetics. She buys these cosmetics from Kampala city shops. She incurs little transport costs to and from shopping.

She wants top use this loan to buy more boxes of creams and Vaseline. Besides this cosmetics shop, she also does some catering services like selling cooked food. She has been in this business for six years. She sells on a retail basis only. Her customers are local people. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges include the rainy season because she works in a muddy place.

Sarah joined MCDT because of its good credit discipline and there are no strings attached when one applies for a loan. She resides in and rents a two room house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and vaseline.

loans.name: Zapote 2 Group

texts.es:
el grupo Zapote 2 esta ubicado en la aldea el Zapote en la ciudad de Choluteca, lo integran 4 mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras y tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
doña Maricela G. se dedica a la venta de mercaderia y ropa, la cual la distribuye en varias aldeas cercanas a su residencia y tambien vende en su casa de habitacion. el credito le sera de mucho beneficio para poder 
trabajar y obtener mucha ultilidades. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia.
doña Ana V. se dedica a la  venta de gallinas, las vende en lugares como el Triunfo, Guasaule y Choluteca esta actividad la realiza de hace varios años, con el credito podra hacer crecer su negocio y obtener mas ganancias y de esta manera tener una mejor calida de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar gallinas.
doña Felipa L. tambien se dedica a la venta de gallinas, las vende en localidades y comunidades cercanas a su casa de habitacion, con el credito comprara mas gallinas. 
doña Gloria O. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas abarroterria y de esta manera poder tener buenos
ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The Zapote 2 Group consists of four hardworking women who have great desire to succeed. They live in the neighborhood of Zapote in the city of Choluteca. A detailed description of their business activities is provided below:

Doña Maricela G. sells merchandise and clothing and distributes her products to different neighborhoods near where she lives. She also sells her goods out of her home. Her loan will be very useful to her because it will allow her to continue working and obtain many benefits. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise.

Doña Ana V. sells chickens in different places such as Triunfo, Guasaule, and Choluteca. She has been in this business for several years. Her loan will enable her to increase her business and generate more income since it will be used to buy more chickens.

Doña Felipa L. also sells chickens in towns and communities near her home. She will use her loan to buy more chickens.

Doña Gloria O. sells popular consumer products. She has a small store in her home. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries so that she can generate a good income to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Chérifq

texts.en: Since 2008, Madame Chérifa A. has had a small general store in which she sells items like soap, canned goods, oil, and other products. She is 29 years old and married with four children. In order to increase her product offering to satisfy her customers and increase her profts, Madame A. has requested a loan of 400,000 CFA to purchase more inventory. This is her first time taking a loan from WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky T. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Pinky is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Pinky owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of bananas in the local community. Pinky has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pinky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pinky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to sell. Pinky is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Pinky from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas & provide working capital

loans.name: Amri

texts.en:
Amri is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling firewood for the last three years. She sells retail to her neighbors, most of whom are women.

In addition, she has houses that she rents as an additional source of income. Previously she operated a business selling flat breads. With the loan of 20,000  KES, she wants to purchase a bundle of firewood to sell as wholesale. 

Amri faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes that in future she will be able to sell charcoal in wholesale. She decided to work with Yehu so she could get financial assistance. The mission of Yehu is to improve small-scale entrepreneurs by providing sustainable financial services. She owns a house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of firewood.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. JUliana Isabel tiene 39 años, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales tres aun son menores de edad, ella se hace cargo de ellos completamente sola, es padre y madre  para ellos. Hace un año, forma parte del grupo "Mujeres Triunfadoras", formado por 8 personas, residentes del distrito de Comas.
Hace 17 años la Sra. Juliana Isabel inició su venta de golosinas de forma ambulatoria, pero hace cuatro años ella ofrece sus caramelos en los omnibus de transporte público pero antes canta un par de canciones.
Los jueves y los domingos vende antiocuhos en la puerta de la casa de sus padres.
Gracias a su trabajo pudo comprar una carreta para poder iniciar su venta de anticuchos, además de mantener económicamente a sus hijos.
Uno de sus proyectos es poner una bodega, para lo cual se esfuerza mucho para poder juntar su capital.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá una partte en la compra de golosinas y otra parte en una operación a la vista que necesita de urgencia para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Juliana Isabel is 39 years old and has five children, three of whom are minors and she is their sole caregiver; she is both a mother and a father to them. A year ago she became part of the "Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Winning Women) group, made up of eight people, all residents of the Comas district. 17 years ago Juliana Isabel started selling soft drinks on foot, but four years ago she began selling candy on public busses. Before beginning her sales, she sings a couple of songs. On Thursdays and Sundays she sells appetizers in front of her parents’ home. Thanks to her work, she was able to buy a cart from where she can make her sales and provide financial support to her children. One of her future projects is to open a store, and she puts forth lots of effort to save her money. She will invest part of the money from this loan in soft drinks and the rest she will use to pay for an eye operation, which she desperately needs in order to be able to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Cecilia Del Rocio

texts.es:
Cecilia de 23 años, vive en una zona periurbana con caminos de tierra llamada “Fortín”. vende ropa por catalogo a sus conocidos para poder mantener a sus hijos.  

Comenzó a vender ropa de una revista hace años con sus pocos ahorros y comenzó a venderlas a sus amigas y conocidos, repartiendo y promocionando la ropa por catalogo desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días y con algunas ganancias que ha obtenido compro víveres para una pequeña tienda. 

Para mejorar sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y víveres como arroz, aceites y azúcar. En el futuro quiere tener su propio minimarket.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 23 years old and lives Fortin, a periurban area that has dirt roads. She sells clothing through a catalog to her acquaintances in order to support her children. With her small savings she began selling clothing from a catalog several years ago and started by selling to her friends and acquaintances. She distributes and promotes the clothing from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. everyday and with some of the profits she bought groceries for a small store. Cecilia wants to buy clothing and groceries such as rice, cooking oils and sugar in order to improve her sales. In the future she hopes to have her own mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, cooking oils and sugar.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 47 years old. Leonida is widowed and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida makes and sells wood products to local businesses and members of her community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leonida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nilda Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nilda, tiene 41 años de edad,  está casada y tienen dos hijos de 13 y 5 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y el otro en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en la Fabril en Manta.
 
Se dedica al comercio, vende  pollos por libras o enteros, tiene un local en el mercado de Tarqui en Manta. Trabaja los viernes, sábados y domingos, desde las 5am hasta las 13h00, los pollos los compra en una granja que está cerca de su casa lo cual facilita la compra y selección de los pollos, luego los traslada hasta su local para venderlos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más pollos porque a veces le hacen falta y un congelador para dejar los pollos hasta el otro día cuando no los pueda vender todos. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda recibida.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando como hasta ahora y poder comprar un carro.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales community bank meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales which is a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture.  The inhabitants of this town carry out a number of different business activities such as handicrafts and general commerce.

This is where we find Nilda who is 41 years old, married and has two children aged 13 and 5.  The eldest child is in high school and the other is in elementary school.  Her husband works for the company La Fabril in the town of Manta.

Nilda sells chickens by the pound or whole.  She has a stall in the Tarqui market in Manta.  She works Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 5.00am to 1.00pm.  She buys the chickens in a farm near her home which makes it possible for her to buy and select chickens.  She then takes them to her stall to sell.

This loan will be used to purchase more chickens because sometimes she doesn't have enough and a freezer in which she can leave the chickens for another day when she can't sell them all.  She has been a member of the community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because of the support she has received.

Her dreams are to continue working as she has up until now and to be able to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy chickens and a freezer

loans.name: Azim

texts.ru: Латыпов Азим житель города Душанбе. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Азим имеет высшее образование. По профессии проработал два года. Сейчас он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения машины. Он продал свою старую машину и хочет купить новую.
texts.en: Azim L. lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 26 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Azim has a higher education.  He worked in his field for two years.  Currently, he provides a taxi service.  He has been in this business for 5 years.  Azim is requesting this loan for the purchase of a car.  He sold his old car and wants to buy a new one.

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
Antonia, viuda, con 3 hijos a su cargo. ElL. es presidenta D. L. Alcancia Comunal "Divino Niño Jesus". Antonia se dedica a L. venta D. medicamentos. Se iniciò con muy poco capital y su negocio se ubica en L. plaza principal D. Chupaca en Huancayo; en sus inicios este negocio fue un Bazar, gracias a èste trabajo logrò terminar sus estudios superiores D. educaciòn. Posteriormente y gracias a sus hermanos quienes estudiaron Farmacia logrò implementar lo que es hasta hoy su Botica "El AguiL.".
Antonia quedò vuida hace 25 años, y se hizo cargo D. sus hijos, quienes por el esfuerzo D. su madre ahora son jovenes con estudios profesionales. El anhelo D. Antonia es que su negocio siga creciendo para poder apoyar a sus hijos con sus maestrìas.
(en L. foto, Antonia es L. cuarta persona D. L. izquierda, señora D. pelo color plateado con lentes, viste chompa color rosa y se encuentra detras del mostrador D. su negocio)
El dinero que se le brinda, lo usarà para comprar mercaderìa para su Botica.
texts.en:
Antonia is a widow with 3 children in her care. She is the president of the "Divino Niño Jesus" ("Divine Child Jesus") loan group. Antonia sells medicines. She started with very little capital and her business is located in the main square of Chupaca in Huancayo. In the beginning her business was a bazaar. Thanks to her work she was able to complete her college education. Later, thanks to her brothers, who studied pharmacy, she was able to set up what has been until today her pharmacy "El AguiL." ("The Eagle").

Antonia became a widow 25 years ago and took charge of her children. Thanks to her efforts they are now young professionals. Antonia´s wish is for her business to continue to grow so as to be able to support her children through their master's degrees. 

(In the picture Antonia is the fourth person from the left - the silver-haired lady with glasses, wearing a pink sweater and standing behind the counter of her shop). 

She is going to use the money lent to her to buy merchandise for her pharmacy.

loans.use: Increase merchandise stock for pharmacy.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick O. is 24 years old and from the Obunga area in Kisumu. He is married to Eunice who runs a small business in the estate. They have two children- Evans, 7 years old and Carolyne, 1 year old.

Fredrick has a motorcycle, which he uses to ferry goods and people from one area to another. This has been his business for the past five years. He is currently applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, to buy spare parts for the motorbike and also to enable him to open up a retail shop to run alongside the transport business. 

His main desire is to see his business expand and increase his profits to able him cater to his family's needs.

loans.use: Buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda Z. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Daylinda is separated from her spouse and has ten adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling seafood products, including fish like mackerel and milk fish, in the local community. Daylinda has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Daylinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like sardines and mackerel. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like sardines and mackerel

loans.name: Anna Leah

texts.en: Anna Leah M. is from the village of Ponce St., Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anna Leah owns and operates a business providing internet services in the local community. Anna Leah has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Anna Leah joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anna Leah is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anna Leah from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Phou

texts.en: Phou C., 58, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. sells fresh water, earning an income of USD $1.6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD $60 on food and USD $50 on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase groceries to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: Buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Fotunata Marcela

texts.es: Fortunata tiene 42 años de edad y es una mujer emprendedora, ella se encarga de los gastos de movilidad de su hija quién se está preparando para ingresar a la universidad y por eso trabaja arduamente para pagar la mensualidad de la academia de su hija. Ella realiza tejidos manuales como: tapetes, colchas, cojines, chompas, gorros y mucho más a crochet y palitos. Fortunata teje artesanalmente  para vender  hace más de 20 años, pero en realidad aprendió a tejer desde pequeña debido a la enseñanza de su madre. Fortunata está feliz con la actividad que realiza ya que logró formar una pequeña cantidad de clientes en el extranjero a quienes les envía  los tejidos que le encargan realizar y también tiene clientes fijos por la zona donde vive. Ella solicitó el préstamo para comprar más materiales (lana de colores e hilos) para comenzar a tejer los pedidos que tiene pendiente y la mitad lo invertirá en el pago de la matrícula de su hija. A Fortunata le gustaría enseñar tejidos manuales y vender variedad de lanaspara tejido.
texts.en:
Fortunata is an enterprising  42 year old  woman.  Her daughter is preparing to go away to college and Fortunata is working arduously to pay for her  transportation expenses and monthly academic fees.   She hand crochets rugs, afghans, pillows, sweaters and hats.  She has been working as an artisan and selling her wares for more than 20 years.  Her mother taught her to crochet when she was very young.  Fortunata is happy with this activity since she has a small number of foreign customers that she sends her crocheted items to and also, has a stable customer base where she lives.  

She will use half of the loan to purchase materials (dyed wool and yarn) to start crocheting for pending orders and the other half to pay her daughter's enrollment fees.  Fortunata would like to teach hand crocheting and sell a variety of crocheted wool items.

loans.use: To purchase dyed wool and yarn

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is one of four members of this group loan. She belongs to Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family. She came here seven years ago. 

She is 27 years old, married to A. and has two children. Her elder son is in kindergarten while younger one has not started attending school yet. He is only 3 years old.
 
Her husband is a loader by profession and operates a loading business. He puts loads like vegetables, fruits or construction supplies on his donkey cart and delivers them from one place to another.
 
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy a new donkey cart. His current cart has become rough and urgently needs replacement. With a new cart, he will be able to load more and earn better profits by providing better quality services to his clients. 

Kalsoom is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and make him more profits in the future.
  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year she proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Ochirsuuri

texts.en: Ochirsuuri, 26, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger (a traditional Mongolian tent) on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past four years. They have a decent standard of living. They used to live in the countryside and owned some livestock before they came to the town in order to send their children to school. Ochirsuuri began making woodcraft items in 2007. He makes wooden products including home furniture and ger structural parts at home and sells them at a local market. Now he has several regular customers and his business has become more stable. He pays much attention to the quality of his products to attract more customers. He wants to carry on this business and expand production. He is a hard-working person with initiative who says: "I am trying to expand my business and increase my working capital. I am also planning to buy a car." He is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to purchase more timber and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber and materials

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and water bills.

She operates a retail shop business, selling household goods from home to her neighbours and passersby. Emily does farming which is her other source of income. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sacks of beans, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu because of the availability of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, sacks of beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia W. M. is a single woman with two children, 11 and 15 years old, whom she hopes to educate to university level. Teresia's business is located in the Waithaka area of Nairobi. She owns a food kiosk where she sells ready made food to constructors and other local people. Teresia also sells timber. She has been in business for eight years and has managed to employ two people. Teresia says that her business is profitable and that her major challenge is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business going well.

Teresia is using her loan of 20,000 KES to add stock to her timber business in order to expand it since it is doing very well. She hopes to grow her business and, in the future, to own at least two restaurants in town. Teresia describes herself as a very focused person.

loans.use: to buy more timber

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and known for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Maryam Abad. She moved here many years ago. She is 46 years old and married to A. M. who operates a loading/unloading business with his donkey cart. 

Safia herself is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household chores. She has two children: a son and a daughter. Both of them were not able to get an education due to financial constraints.  

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to assist her husband financially. Using the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because his current cart is not in a position to let him load heavy items on it. With the new cart, he will be able to transport heavy loads which will help him do his job better and earn increased profits. 

Safia hopes that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Safia.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading/unloading business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. 

Gina has been in this business for 21 years. Gina earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman with two girls, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills, electricity bills, food and clothing.

Dorcas has operated a cereals business for the past 3 years, selling in a shop and at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and purchasing a van for transport business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase 2 sacks of ground nuts, beans and sunflower seeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of ground nuts, beans and sunflower seeds for resale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 37 years old and married to John who contributes to the family income. She has been running her grocery store for a period of about four years with an income of about 13,100 Kenya shillings a month. 


This is her first loan from KADET and she wants to use it to start a beauty shop as a secondary income-generating project. She hopes to have a leading beauty salon in the area and give her children quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To start a beauty shop.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El señor Orlando tiene una licorería la que atiende todas las noches y también trabaja en una fábrica de losetas. Con los ingresos que obtiene  mantiene a su esposa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cabinas telefónicas para instalar en la licorería para aumentar sus ingresos. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Brasil de la ciudad de el Alto; es casado y no tiene hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Orlando has a liquor store that he tends to every night and he also works at a paving stone factory.  He supports his wife with the income he earns.  He needs the loan to buy phone booths to install in his liquor store to increase his income.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Brasil zone.  He’s married and has no children.  This is his first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy phone booths to install in his liquor store to increase his income.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia, 59 years old, is married. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of goods. Aside from this she is also engaged in raising hogs. Evelia has had this retail shop for ten years and her hog business for five years. Each month she earns about 4,000 PHP in her retail shop and 2,500 PHP in her hog raising business.

Evelia is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase bread, soft drinks, sugar, snacks, canned goods, milk, shampoo, soap and coffee for her shop. In the future she hopes to grow her businesses so that she can increase her profits and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bread, soft drinks, sugar, snacks, canned goods, milk, shampoo, soap and coffee for her shop.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Bousso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra Bousso est créé depuis le 10 décembre 2010,il est composé de 34 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et s'activent dans la couture, teinture, la restauration et le petit commerce.


Madame Sokhna est la présidente du Banc Villageois, elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants et a en charge sa mère; elle est couturière et mène aussi une activité de petit commerce avec une bonne expérience de 26 ans. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo et a levé la main gauche.

Elle achète ses marchandises ( habits,perles,bracelets, colliers...) dans les villes et vend partout où il y a des cérémonies religieuses de grande envergure et dans les marchés hebdomadaires.


Elle souhaite avec son crédit renforcer son commerce afin de gagner plus de revenus.



Elle prend en charge la scolarité, la nourriture, l'habillement et la santé des enfants et de sa mère.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Diarra Bousso Solidarity Group was established on December 10, 2010.  It is made up of 34 women who live in the same neighborhood and who work in dressmaking, dyeing, running restaurants, and as retailers.

Madam Sokhna is the president of the Village Bank.  She is the married mother of four children and also looks after her mother.  She is a seamstress and also manages a small retail business with 26 years of experience.  She is the first on the right of the photograph, raising her left hand.

She purchases her merchandise (outfits, beads, bracelets, necklaces, etc.) in the cities and sells wherever there are large-scale religious ceremonies and in the weekly markets.

With this loan, she hopes to strengthen her business in order to earn greater profits.  She pays for the schooling, food, clothing, and health needs of her children and her mother.

loans.use: to purchase outfits, beads, bracelets, and necklaces for resale.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is a 27 year old Rwandan entrepreneur. She is married and has 2 children between the ages of 4 months and 4 years. Neither of her children are in school and her husband owns a bar.

For the past 12 years, Clotilde has been running a general store in which she sells cooking oil, salt, sugar, rice, and other goods. Her store is doing well and she will use this loan to purchase more goods to meet the demands of her customers and to continue to earn profits. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. She dreams of someday having a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy items such as cooking oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 26-year-old young woman, who is married and has one son and two daughters. She lives in Gaza city in Palestine, and her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Muna's husband wants to license his taxi which helps to get additional income for the family but he doesn't have enough cash to pay for the license, so Muna needs to take a loan of $1,000.

The taxi is the family's source of income and Muna's husband can't park the car till he saves enough money for the fees. Muna is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead of her beside the taxi.

loans.use: to cover her husband's taxi license fees.

loans.name: Brenda Verónica

texts.es: Brenda Verónica de veinte y cinco años de edad, habita en casa familiar con su madre y una hermana en zona urbana del país. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que no deja pasar ninguna oportunidad de negocio. Brenda posee un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en un car wash que desde hace varios años le ha ayudado para poder dar a su familia un poco de ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar. Ella es de la idea que la única forma de salir adelante y aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida es trabajando duramente, y eso es lo que hace cada día desde muy temprano. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio, con el fin de hacerlo crecer y verlo florecer en el futuro. El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar accesorios y una maquina de presión de agua y aspirado de carpetas o alfombras que le permitan hacer más rápido su trabajo y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. De esta manera espera tener la oportunidad de accesar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Brenda Verónica, age 25, lives in the family home with her mother and sister.  They live in an urban zone in the country.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who does not pass up any business opportunity.

Brenda has a small business, a car wash.  For several years it has helped her be able to give her family a little income to support the household.  She believes that the only way to get ahead and to pursue a better quality of life is by working hard.  That is what she does starting very early every day.

She has made the decision to request this loan from Integral in order to invest in her business so that it will grow and to see it flourish.  She needs the requested loan to buy accessories, a water pressure machine, and a carpet vacuum; which will allow her to do her work more quickly and to give her customers better service.  This is the way she hopes to have the opportunity to access a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy accessories and a machine to wash cars.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a very supportive lady by nature. She operates a boutique business where she makes well designed clothes and displays them in her boutique, which attracts many customers towards her and helps her increase her sales. Her collection and designs helps her to get regular orders. She mainly receives orders from customers in her neighborhood. Razia's income helps her pay school fees for her three children, who are getting an education. 
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her boutique business. With the loan, she will purchase cloth in bulk quantity to be able to prepare dresses and fulfill customer demand in a timely fashion. She is very confident that a loan investment will help her grow and improve her business and increase her profits.  
Razia is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: to buy cloth for preparing dresses for her boutique.

loans.name: Elsa Cristina

texts.es:
La Señorita Elsa es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de sembríos, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señorita. Elsa tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 3 años de edad, vive con su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa en la que habita es propia de sus padres.

Nuestra socia es de profesión costurera, esta actividad aprendió estudiando y reforzó sus conocimientos con el trabajo, ahora en su casa se dedica a realizar bordados. Como pasa en casa también trabaja en su tienda la cual tiene hace un año y allí labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia y crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Feria Libre community bank.  She lives on the outskirts of the parish of Cumbe, which is a cold area filled with cultivated fields.  Her people maintain the culture and traditions of their villages; they trade, raise animals, and farm.
 
Elsa is 24 years old.  She is the single mother of a three-year-old girl, and she lives with her mother, with whom she shares the household expenses.  The house belongs to her parents.

By profession, Elsa is a seamstress.  She studied this trade and built up her knowledge through her work.  Now she makes embroidery at home.  Since she does this from home, she opened a shop a year ago, and she works there everyday from 7 am to 7 pm.

This is her second loan, and she will invest it  in buying rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other staples for her shop.

Her goal is to have her own house and to see her business grow further.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other staples.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a farmer in the Nkubu area of central Kenya. He is 61 years of age and married with seven children, all of whom are adults. He has been in farming for the last 30 years producing bananas, maize, beans, coffee and milk and selling to the local market. He also works with the P.C.E.A church, which provides additional income.

Samwel has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income from farming to purchase a extra parcel of land to expand his farming by introducing both pigs and dairy goats to his farm.

He says they face challenges as a result of pests and diseases, but he remains optimistic and appreciative of Juhudi Kilimo for their support of farmers.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Walter William

texts.es:
