Walter de 28 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposa e hijos, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Walter se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y cerdos), desde hace 6 años, cuenta con sus corrales apropiados para sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos  naturales para engordarlos y pueda venderlos a sus clientes a un buen precio, obteniendo ingresos para solventar sus necesidades familiares.  

El negocio de Walter cada día crece más por lo que ha creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado y sanidad de  sus animales, al tenerlos bien alimentados a sus animales tendrá mayores ventas y con los ingresos podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado, mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y pueda ofrecerles otras oportunidades académicas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Walter, 28, lives with his wife and children in his own house. The house, which has electricity, is located in the Tambogrande district, which is part of the department of Piura.  It is a region of agriculture, herding and handicrafts.

Walter has been raising and selling pen animals (sheep and pigs) for the last six years.  He has his own pens for his animals, and he gives them balanced feed and allows them to graze to fatten them so he can sell them to his clients at a good price and obtain the income he needs for his household expenses.

Walter's business has been growing day by day.  He is seeking a loan of 1000 new soles ($375)  from microfinance partner  Edpyme Alternativa to buy additional balanced feed and medicine for his animals; when they are well-fed, they sell better, and with that income he can pay off the loan, thereby improving his quality of life and making him able to offer better opportunities for schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy more balanced feed and medicine for his animals.

loans.name: Domitille

texts.en: Domitille is married and has three children aged 3 to 7 years old. Her husband works as a mechanic. She buys cash crops of sorghum and beans and resells them. She has been doing this for one year and this business has helped her support her family. Domitille would like a loan to add more inventory to her reselling business. She will use the profits to create a savings for her future. She would eventually like to import crops from other countries in order to make bigger profits.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans for resale.

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Nheb is 40 years old with 4 children. He is a farmer and he also fishes for additional income. He has been a farmer for 10 years. This is his third loan with VisionFund. He requested a loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland and do fishing. With this loan, he hopes to increase his crop yield with good quality to earn more income for his family in order to feed his family and have some savings for the future and his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland and do fishing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Montesiu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Montesisu está conformado por Martha, María, Cristian Isabel, Narcisa y Estebana cinco mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es Matha de 54 años quien hace 3 años tiene un negocio de tragamonedas  el cual lo inicio por ayuda de su hermano, además de eso vende gaseosas, cigarros y licor.

Mientras María vende prendas de oro, perfumes y juguetes, Cristian Isabel comercializa desde hace 5 años productos Avon, Narcisa desde hace 30 años se dedica a la costura  y Estebana es fotógrafa y vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Montesisu" is made up of 5 hardworking and enterprising women: Martha, Maria, Cristian Isabel, Narcisa and Estebana.  Martha, 54, is the coordinator of the group.  For 3 years, she has had a slot machine business which she started with the help of her brother.  In addition to this, she sells soft drinks, cigarettes and liquor.

Maria sells gold jewelry, perfumes and toys, Cristian Isabel has been selling Avon products for 5 years, Narcisa has been a dressmaker for 30 years, and Estebana is a photographer who sells cosmetics.

loans.use:
to buy soft drinks, cigarettes, and beer, and to make improvements 
to her machine

loans.name: Lydia

texts.es: Lydia, de 49 años es una mujer responsable. Enviudó hace 3 años, en todo este tiempo tuvo que sacar adelante a 2 de sus 5 hijos: Bryan y Gustavo con los que vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo. Todas las mañanas ella despierta convencida que tendrá un buen día. Pues se dirige a una fuente de soda donde aprende todo lo necesario para poder ella misma abrir uno propio. Su trabajo consiste en elaborar jugos de diferentes frutas, como también atender a la clientela que visita el lugar. Cuenta que le pagan un promedio de 20 nuevos soles diarios. Ya por las tardes abre sus puertas para vender los ricos caldos y sustancias que ella sabe preparar con mucha dedicación, de lunes a domingo sin descanso; los días que vende más son los fines de semana, por ello no deja de trabajar. También alquila cuartos en su casa, con su ganancia está juntando dinero para abrir un restaurante grande y surtido, donde puede ofrecer toda variedad de comida, sabe que lo conseguirá porque ella es una mujer trabajadora. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le agrada pertenecer a una asociación responsable y solidaria. Lydia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de sillas y mesas para acondicionar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lydia is 49 years old and is a very responsible woman.  She became a widow three years ago and during this time she has had to more two of her five children ahead, Bryan and Gustavo, who live with her in her own home in El Tambo.  Every morning she awakens knowing that she will have a good day.  She is talking about a soda fountain where she learns everything she needs to know about starting her own.  Her work consists of making juices from different fruits and tending to customers.  She is paid 20 PEN per day.  In the evening she opens to sell the delicious soups and things that she knows how to prepare with much dedication.  She works seven days a week without a break.  Most of her sales come on weekends, so she keeps working.  She also rents out rooms in her home.  She is saving her earnings to be able to open a large well stocked restaurant where she can offer a wide variety of food.  She knows that she will do it because she is hard working.

This will be her third loan through MFP, where she awaits your support to be able to continue her work.  She also promises to make her payments on time and she is happy to belong to such a united and responsible group.  She will use the money from this loan to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Louis

texts.fr: Louis est âgé de 39 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Odile. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Louis n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Louis mène comme activité depuis vingt cinq ans environs, la culture des céréales (haricot) qu’il vend dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette  activité, Louis fait l’élevage des porcs. C'est dans sa région que Louis exerce ses activités. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Louis sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Louis ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Louis is 39 years old and is married to a retail merchant named Odile. The couple has six children, of whom some attend school but all are dependents. In addition to their own children, the couple has one other child to support. Louis did not attend school. The couple shares responsibility for the various family expenditures.

For the past 25 years Louis has been growing beans to provide for his needs and those of his family. He sells his crops at a market in Benin. Alongside this activity, Louis also raises pigs, and carries out his activities in the surrounding area.

To strengthen his business and better serve his customers, Louis is requesting a fifth credit loan from ALIDé. His ambition is to increase the level of his activity. The four previously granted loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and food products for cultivation.

loans.name: Edgar Geovani

texts.es:
El señor es soltero, tiene 25 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica al servicio de transporte, inicio este trabajo debido a la necesidad de contar con dinero y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de un repuesto que se le fue a su auto, espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en: He is single and 25 years old; he never went to school.  He provides transportation services.  He started this work because he needed to have money and to date has five years’ experience.  He’s asking for a loan to buy a spare part he needs for his car.  In the future he hopes to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Legne Maricel

texts.es:
Legne Maricel tiene 22 años es casada, vive con el esposo y con los  hijos de 4 y 1 año. Vive en el Recinto San Temistocles en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Legne  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener un terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Legne Maricel is 22 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children (ages 4 and 1) in the neighborhood of San Temistocles in the canton of Ventanas.

The Communal Bank “Narcisa de Jesus” is located in the neighborhood of San Temistocles, which is in the canton of Ventanas. This group consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Legne is a farmer who has been growing corn for two years. She buys her supplies in Ventanas and sells her products at the market in the same place. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice. This will be a great help with increasing her income for the consumer needs of her family and for investment. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

She enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Mrs. Chhin, 47, is in this photo in front of her house in Kompong Cham province. She is a loving mother of four children and a single parent who is engaged in the agricultural business. Besides farming within the rainy season, Mrs. Chhin also works at home as a hammock weaver to generate additional income of $1.50 per day. Presently, two of her children are apprentice goldsmiths who now are training in one of the province markets, and they’ll finish their class soon. Mrs. Chhin realizes that her sons will need many types of tools and raw materials for this career if they start up their own business after the class. For this reason, Mrs. Chhin would like to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase some types of tools and raw materials, which will be used in the process of making and fixing gold materials. She hopes that she will be able to pursue a better standard of living when her two sons’ business starts growing.

loans.use: to purchase some tools and raw materials, which will be used in the process of making and fixing gold materials.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man. He has six children whose ages range from eight to twenty-five. He describes himself as determined, patient and friendly. 

He operates a Nissan garage where he provides motorvehicle repairs. He has been involved in this business for fifteen years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as being having insufficient funds to buy spare parts. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare wheels for motor vehicles. His business goal is to run a car rental company providing transportation; he hopes to do this within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy spare wheels for motor vehicles.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.fr: Beauty est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Adidogomé  avec ses quatre enfants et son mari. Beauty est âgée de 41 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Beauty est une marchande de pagnes qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Beauty sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes de qualités afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à leur épanouissement.

loans.use: Acheter 26 pièces de pagnes.

loans.name: Alba Nibia

texts.en:
Alba lives in the city of Cadereyta in the State of Nuevo Leon. She is married and she has one small child. Some time ago her husband was let go from the company where he worked and they went through some difficult times. For this reason Alba had the idea to start her own busines and started a small grocery store with the money they had given her husband for his retirement. Arduous work has been the factor that has permitted Alba and her husband to give their son what he needs despite the adverisities they faced.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $250to be able to keep up and slowly grow the busines. This amount will be invested in merchandise to have a better variety in her store and thus increase her sales. Help Alba and her family. They are in need of your generosity. Do no doubt it any longer. Decide and support them.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Alba vive en la localidad de Cadereyta, en el estado de Nuevo león, es casada y tiene un hijo pequeño, hace tiempo que despidieron a su esposo de la empresa para la que trabajaba, y estaban pasando por momentos muy difíciles. Fue por ello que Alba tuvo la idea de iniciar su propio negocio y puso una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, con el dinero que le habían dado a su esposo por el retiro. El trabajo arduo ha sido la constante que ha permitido que Alba y su esposo puedan darle su hijo lo que necesita a pesar de las adversidades.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS para poder seguir y crecer poco apoco, con esta cantidad invertirá en mercancía para tener más surtida la tienda e incrementar sus ventas. Ayuda a Alba y su familia, ellos necesitan de tu generosidad, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Chairs, tables, plates, spoons and cups for her hotel/restaurant

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Mrs. Chab S. M. is 48 years old and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes her living by growing fruit and rice crops and raises pigs on her small piece of land. She barely makes enough money to cover her family's expenses, and the responsibility for supporting the entire household is her husband's who is a carpenter and typically makes around $4/day in revenue. One of her daughters is pictured here because her parents are at their plantation, while the rest are students.
Chab S. M. is requesting a loan of $700 to help in agriculture works by digging a well for her plantation's water system and to purchase a piece of land, so that she can grow a variety of crops in her grove. In the future, she hopes to own another piece of land to expand her cultivation as well as animal raising.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land  and dig a well to grow crops

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy O. is married with 5 children and is 50 years old. She comes from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Joy has been with LAPO for 10 years. She sells foodstuffs and meats. She needs a loan of $325 to buy bags of rice, beans, and other foodstuffs to expand the inventory of her little shop.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, beans, etc. to expand her inventory

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Mrs. Phun R., age 48, is a housewife. Her husband, age 52, sells traditional medicines to earn $3 per day. They have five children, four of whom she shared information about. Two children are employed at a hotel and two of their children are students. She is pictured with one of her daughters in the photo. She would like to request this loan to purchase pigs to raise to generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: Mrs. Phun would like to purchase pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a hard working woman who has been a source of help to her family.  Patience is 63 years old, married to Mr. O. and has 5 children.  She has a poultry farm where she rears birds and also sells them to the public.  She is currently a LAPO member and she has been in business since 2000.  "I need a loan of $800 to buy more birds and goats for sale", says Mrs. Patience O.

loans.use: To buy more goats & birds to sell

loans.name: Ketut

texts.id:
C. spends 4-5 bags of flour (1 bag = 25kg) to bake bread every day. One bag of flour costs him 135,000 IDR (1 USD ~ 9,000 IDR). He could gross 500,000 IDR per day with a working capital of 1,000,000 IDR. He has seven employees which he pays 20,000 IDR per day. He is also helped by his wife. The loan is going to be used to buy a transportation equipment. The vehicle is going to be used to distribute his goods. By doing so he could expand his distribution, hence increasing his production and enhancing his profit. Raising his third grade kid is one of his main priorities for the time being

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

C. menghabiskan 4 - 5 sak tepung (1 sak = 25 kg) untuk membuat kue per harinya. Satu sak tepung harganya Rp 135.000,00. Modal sebesar Rp 1.000.000,00/hari bisa memberikan keuntungan kotor Rp 500.000,00. Dia memiliki 7 anak buah yang dibayar Rp 20.000,00/hari. Dia juga dibantu oleh isterinya. Pinjaman modal yang diperoleh akan digunakan untuk membeli alat transportasi. Kendaraan yang dibeli akan digunakan untuk memasarkan hasil usahanya. Hal ini bertujuan memperluas distribusi sehingga semakin banyak produksi yang akhirnya akan menambah keuntungan yang diterima. Salah satu yang menjadi pertimbangannya adalah anaknya yang sekarang masih kelas 3 Sekolah Dasar (SD).

loans.use: to purchase transportation equipment

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es:
Rosalva is a woman who likes to fight for her dreams. One of her dreams is to see her children going to college and having a greater chance of having a better quality of life than she did. This is why Rosalva started selling furniture three years ago. However, the sales of these type of products are very slow, and this is why she started selling clothing, which is what she does now. Little by little she has assembled a clientele who seeks her out to buy clothing from her.

However, Rosalva does not have enough merchandise to offer to her customers, and this is why she is requesting a loan for US $550, which she is willing to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money Rosalva will be able to buy clothing for the season to be able to offer it to her customers. With your help Rosalva will be able to succeed with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalva es una mujer a la que le gusta luchar por sus sueños. Y uno de ellos es ver que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera y tengan mayores probabilidades de tener un mejor nivel de vida. Es por eso que Rosalva comenzó desde hace 3 años a vender muebles pero las ventas de estos productos eran muy lentas, fue por eso que comenzó a vender ropa, a lo que se dedica actualmente. Poco a poco se a ido haciendo de clientela que la busca para comprarle ropa.

Sin embargo Rosalva no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Rosalva podrá comprar más ropa de temporada para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rosalva podrá salir adelante con sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Keng

texts.en: Mrs. Keng K., who is 48, works as an animal breeder making  about $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Ouk Nan, 51, is a taxi driver who earns around $3 per day. This couple has 6 children. One of the elder sons is a seller in the Poip Pet province and earns about $3 per day and two others work as garment workers and receive $50 each per month. To help the household, this family needs a loan around $250 to breed pigs.

loans.use: This couple use this loan to purchase pigs and resell for profit.

loans.name: Zulmira

texts.es:
Zulmira belongs to the Las Ucayalinas Community Bank group located at 1 Jr. Maya de Brito Cdra., in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and the mother of 6 children. Her husband is a fisherman but the income that he earns doesn't cover the expenses of the household. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she purchased fish to sell.

Now she sells fish in the Bellavista market as a street vendor. At 5 am, she has plenty to sell, but with the demand that she has, she runs out of fish early. In the afternoons she works taking care of her children and her home.

With this loan of 1200 soles, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy traps, fish of different species and maintain their boat.

Zulmira is very thankful for the loans that she's received from Manuela Ramos. It's a big help and with the earnings she is able to save money and give the best to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zulmira pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Ucayalinas, ubicado en el Jr. Maya de Brito Cdra. 1, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es pescador pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertirlo en la compra y venta de pescado. En la actualidad ella vende sus pescados en el mercado de Bellavista, es vendedora ambulante, a las 5 AM. ya esta en plena venta y con la demanda que tiene sus pescados termina temprano, y en las tardes se dedica a sus hijos y su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de tramperas, pescados de diferentes especies y dar mantenimiento a su bote. Zulmira se siente muy bien con los préstamos recibidos de Manuela Ramos es un apoyo grande y le da ganancias para poder ahorrar, y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda Jiménez is married and has three kids, two of them are married. One of them works at a bank and the other one is a housewife. Her younger one is single, has a job but still lives at home.

She began her beauty salon business where she offers services as: hairstyling, perms, haircuts and more. She did this in order to help her husband with everyday home and children expenses. She wanted to offer her family a better quality of life.

She is actually requesting a loan of $350 which she will pay in 4 months. She will use this money to buy some materials that she still needs in order to offer some specific services. With your help Hilda will be able to move on.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda Jiménez es casada y tiene tres hijos, dos ya son mayores y están casadas, una de ellas trabaja en un banco y la otra se dedica al hogar, el menor es soltero y trabaja aun vive en casa. Ella decidió iniciar su negocio, un salón de belleza donde ofrece diversos servicios como peinados, permanentes, cortes de cabello y mas, lo hizo para apoyar a su marido con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos, ya que querían ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar algunos materiales que le hacen falta para realizar diversos servicios. Con tu ayuda Hilda saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of working materials

loans.name: Franck

texts.fr:
Mr. Franck E. is 36 and single. To make a living, he purchases and sells various products in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. With this FECECAV loan, he hopes to restock his store in order to respond to customer demand and to participate in the development of his community.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur Franck E. est âgé de 36 ans et pas encore marié. Pour gagner de l’argent, il achète et revend les pièces détachées à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce crédit de FECECAV, il espère renforcer sa boutique dans l’achat de pièces détachées afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse de la population et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: To restock his store

loans.name: Moh

texts.fr:
Moh B. is 28 years old and lives with her husband, her four children, and her co-wife in a polygamous family in the district of Heremakono Nord de Bougouni (prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She learned her business from her mother at a young age and has total mastery of this business. She has had an association with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for five years and has benefited from seven loans, including four individual loans, all of which were repaid correctly.

She gets her supplies at the grand market of Bamako and sells articles at the Bougouni market. With this loan, she intends to buy 15 pieces of Wax-brand cloth and 10 pieces of embroidered fabric (which are very popular fabrics in West Africa). Her customer base is composed of women visiting the Bougouni marketplace. She expects to realize a monthly benefit of 50,000 francs CFA which will enable her to pay the loan interest and to help her husband to cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Moh B. est agée de 28 ans et vit avec son mari ses 4 enfants et sa coepouse dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de Bougouni (préfecture de la 3ème région administrative de la République Mali).

Elle a apris cette activité dès son jeune âge auprès de sa mère, et a une maîtrise totale de cette activité. Elle est en relation avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 5 ans et a bénéficié de sept prets dont quatre prets individuels tous remboursés correctement.

Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bamako et vend ses articles au marché de Bougouni. Avec ce pret elle compte acheter quinze pièces de tissus Wax et dix pièces de tissus brodés (Tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest). Sa clientèle est composée de femmes fréquentant le marché de Bougouni. Elle compte réalier un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA. Qui la permettra de payer les intérêts du prêt et aider son mari à assurer les dépenses de la famille

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Ana Lucia is 42 years old, married and has one two year old daughter. Her husband is a teacher, and she works as a seamstress to support themselves. Four years ago her husband helped her buy a sewing machine to be able to do so.

She began this business because she saw a need to help her husband in building their home, where they would need more income to make some improvements. With the time that she has had the business she has gained a lot of experience and would like to continue improving to offer quality service to her clients. With the requested loan she will purchase rafters and zinc to repair the roof of their house so that winter does not affect their home.

Doña Ana Lucia tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene una niña de 2 años. Su esposo es docente, y ella para apoyarlos se dedica a la costura. Su esposo hace 4 años le ayudó en la compra de una máquina de coser para poder realizar esta actividad.

Ella empezó este negocio porque se vió en la necesidad de apoyar a su marido en la construcción de su vivienda, necesitaban más ingresos para poder hacer algunas mejoras. Con el tiempo que ha tenido el negocio ha adquirido mucha experiencia y desea seguir mejorando para ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus clientes. Con el crédito solicitado comprará perlines y zinc para reparar el techo de su vivienda, para que el invierno no les afecte su vivienda.

Translated by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rafters and zinc to repair roof

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 28-year-old young man. He is single and very dedicated to his work. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits etc. in his neighborhood.

Alex wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, spices, washing soaps and powders etc. to expand his business. He hopes to save more to build a shop since he operates out of a rented store which is very costly to him. He belongs to the community group called 'Mamuli Trust Group'. The group members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans on time.

loans.use: To more rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, spices, washing soaps and powders etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Sambath Village Group

texts.en:
FourteE. people in Chrolong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province have formed a village bank, and are asking for a loan which they will use for different purposes. Mrs. Sam S. is the village bank president and she breeds cows. Her husband, Mr. Yean Saly, is a fisherman in the local lake. Unfortunately, he can no longer fish because his boat is too old. In order to restart this business, his wife, Mrs. Sam S. decided to ask for a loan for a new boat for her husband's business. Mrs. Sam S. is 39 years old and the mother of six childrE., one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a fisherman. The other three attend school, while the youngest one is only four years old. Mrs. Sam S. was too busy with her work, so her husband is shown in the photo. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to repay. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sewing machine and accessories

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal San Gabriel. Gregoria tiene 26 años y 2 hijos de 9 y 4 años, sus 2 hijos están en la escuela.
Gregoria tiene su negocio de venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas, vende todos los días en una esquina, en  una avenida donde transita mucha gente, cerca de su casa, Gregoria empezó con este negocio hace 2 años. 
Gregoria necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la reparación y mantenimiento de su carrito sanguchero sándwich 
Gregoria sueña con salir adelante con su negocio y en el futuro tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the San Gabriel microfinance institute. She is a 26-year-old mother with 2 school age children, ages 9 and 4. Gregoria sells hamburgers and salchipapas (Peruvian street food made of pan-fried sausages and French fries) for a living. She works everyday on a corner of a very busy avenue near her home. Gregoria started this business 2 years ago. She needs a loan of 400.00 PEN, which will be invested in the maintenance and repair of her food cart. Gregoria dreams of moving her business forward and opening up her own store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of food cart

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una señora D. 53 años, viuda, vive con su hijo. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza D. animales por más D. 40 años. Dentro D. todas las actividades que realiza, lo que mayormente le gusta hacer es criar a sus animales, sobre todo sus vaquitas, a las que todas las mañanas orD.ña para sacar la deliciosa leche fresca, y venderla o procesar quesos con ella, lo cual es muy rentable, ya que los lleva a las ferias para venderlos a precios que compensen su trabajo. A la mayoría las personas les agrada consumir leche y queso y Francisca sólo tiene que bien alimentar a sus vacas para que puedan  producir mayor cantidad. Lo difícil es cuando estas vaquitas tienen sus crías y la producción minora por un lapso D. tiempo. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita Francisca desea adquirir una nueva vaquita.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her son. She worked in agriculture and has raised animals for more than 40 years. Out of all of her projects, she enjoys raising cattle the most. She goes out every morning to milk her cows in order to get the delicious, fresh milk that she sells or makes into cheese, which is a very profitable business. She takes the cheese to various markets where she sells them at prices that make all her hard work worth it. Many people enjoy drinking milk and eating cheese and all Francisca has to do is feed her cows well for them to produce in greater quantities. The most difficult time for her business is when her cows have calves and their production for her business diminishes for a period of time. This is Francisca’s first loan with MFP; she plans to purchase another cow with the money she wishes to borrow.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a milk producing cow

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Din S., 41, is a rice farmer who lives in Kandal Province, while her husband is a bricklayer. She has two children, both of whom are single and in school. S. and her husband work hard farming rice to support the family's daily expenses.

Besides farming rice, S. purchases rice from her neighbors or from another village and then resells for profits.The business has gone well and now it is time for her to restock. Hence, S. would like to request a loan to purchase rice stocks.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis T. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Mavis cooks rice for sale at Bantama in Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a businessman. Mavis uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Mavis will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more rice and other ingredients to meet the demand of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mavis plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more rice and other ingredients for cooking dishes for sale

loans.name: Dilmurat

texts.en:
K. Dilmurat is 39 years old. He is married with 7 children. He raises and sells cattle at the market. This is a very profitable business especially during the season of the celebrations. He has been in this business since 1999. He purchases his cattle at a local market called “Vahdat”. Dilmurat has a friendly family who always help each other, as you can see at the photo. He has naver made a loan with IMON International and is requesting his first one in order to purchase two more cows. This is especially important for his commerce since right now as the prices for cattle has declined. With your help Dilmurat can improve his family’s living condition. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase young cattle for develope business

loans.name: Las Vecinitas Group

texts.es:
el grupo las Vecinitas residen en la colonia 28 de marzo de a ciudad capital, consta de 3 mujeres muy luchadoras. las cuales se detallan a continuacion:
Fermina V. tiene 39 años de edad tiene un hijo y se dedica a la venta de naranjas, mangos, repollo, cebolla entre otros actividad que le genera muy buenos ingresos pero necesita comprar un local ambulante para poder mejorar la antencion de sus clientes.
Blanca B. de 55 años de edad es madre soltera con  3 hijos todos ellos son profesionales, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, desde muy joven empezo a trabajar ya que solo se dedico a trabajar y nunca pudo estudiar porque tenia que ayudarle a su madre a salir adelante con su hogar,
Yarleny G. vivi en union libre, ella tiene 33 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos, ella solo estudio la primaria ya que para su padre no era importante el estudiar sino que ganarse la vida trabajando, ella vende tortillas desde hace mas de 25 años.
todas ellas necesitan este credito para poder hacer crecer sus negocios y darle mejor vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Las Vecinitas group lives in the 28 de marzo neigbourhood in the capital city. The group consists of three women with fighting spirits as follows: Fermina V. is 39-years-old and has one son. She sells oranges, mangos, cabbages, onions and other produce. This brings in good income but she needs to buy a produce stand in order to improve her customer service. Blanca B. is 55-years-old and a single mother with three adult working children. She sells tortillas. She started working at a very young age and was never able to study because she had to help her mother keep the household running. Yarleny G. lives with her common-law husband, is 33-years-old and has 3 children. She only went as far as primary school because her father thought making a living by working was more important than studying. She has been selling tortillas for over 25 years. All three women need this loan in order to make their businesses grow and to improve the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, water, corn flour, lime, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nickel

texts.en: Nickel is a fashion designer; she is 36 years old and married with a child. She sells cloth, tailoring materials and drinks. She has been in this business for over 15 years. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more cloth, tailoring materials, and drinks to sell and a weaving machine for sewing. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth and a weaving machine for sewing

loans.name: Caren Anyango

texts.en:
Caren Anyango O., is a 42-year-old mother of three children and four orphans. She is also a widow. Her husband, along with her sister were both and she has been raising the kids on her own for many years.

Caren fries fish in Obunga and takes them to three different cities for sale: Obuya, Kamkyobo and Kakamega. She says she will use the 10,000 KSH she is asking for to pay for school fees, rent and food for her family. She says her biggest problem right now is that she has pneumonia and the cold of the rainy season is affecting her ability to work. When she cannot work, her friends help her by taking to market the fish she fries and bringing back food for her and her children to eat.

loans.use: To pay school fees, rent, and buy food for her family

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando supports his family through maintaining his meat vending business that is located in the wet market of Cauayan City. He is 37 years old and married to Carlene. His wife is used to accompanying him in their meat vending stall in the market. They have been blessed with only one child, Ruth Anne T.. She is 11 years old and currently in the elementary level of education. Their family currently resides in Barangay San Fermin of Cauayan City. 

Fernando keeps on striving hard to provide for the family’s needs and especially to send their child to school. He simply remembers that when he started their meat vending business, he opened it with very little capital and through their patience and hard work, it has continued growing. Fernando wants to borrow PHP 15,000 ($325 US) to further improve his business and to earn more profit. He also shares that his family must learn to economize in order to become more productive in their business.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for his meat vending business.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Mrs. Delma C. is a 56-year-old widow and resident of Sta. Maria, Tangub City. She is the mother of six children but only one is living with her as her dependent. Her child is now studying in college. As the sole breadwinner since her husband passed away when her children were still young, she engaged in the fish-vending because it was the only way she could easily earn money to support her family. Since the public market is miles away from her home, she decided to put a mini-market in her home, where she displayed the goods to save the fare expenses of delivering them to the market.

Now as a borrower in her second loan cycle with PAGLAUM MPC under the PDP-LP Program, she is applying for the amount of P4,000.00 to add to the capital of her fish-vending business.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza E. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 19 years old. Riza is single. To make a living, Riza owns & operates a  "sari-sari" or general store. In her shop she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Riza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Riza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Riza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Riza is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Riza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Babughirana Women’S Group Kabugho Amina

texts.en: K. Amina is 30 years old and married with six children. Five of her children are schooling and she looks after three dependents who are also schooling. She has been selling tomatoes in big quantities for over ten years. She says even if tomatoes are perishable, she tries her level best to maintain them and supply them when they are in good condition and still fresh. She is using the loan to purchase tomatoes in bigger quantities for sale in markets. She is a happy business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land, a car and construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes.

loans.name: Isack

texts.en: Isack S. is a Tanzanian micro-business entrepreneur and married man. He runs a clothing and shoes shop at  Yombo Kiwalan Ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the business goods from the Karume city market as second hand goods in wholesale and retail. He sells the goods to customers in retail. The business income generated is used to meet his family's daily demands and for business capitalization. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina N. is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuff in the market in Ibadan, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuff to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Janibichi Group

texts.en:
Ester is a member of the B. borrower group in Mwanjelwa,Mbeya,she is 48 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 25,23,20,18, and 15 years.

Ester started her own business selling local beer 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Ester first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Ester hopes to save money and expand her business.

Paulina,Aines another member of the same borrower group,they also requested the loan amount 200,000Tsh Each one in order to expand their own business.

loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. los Milagros.
Eulogia es casada, tiene 49 años y 8 hijos, Eulogia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. ropa y D. las ferias compra cereales que luego procesa en harinas y lo comercializa en la selva ayacuchana.
Eulogia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa.
Los sueños D. Eulogia son educar a sus hijos, ahorrar para comprar una computadora para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of the Communal Bank Señor D. los Milagros (Lord of Miracles). Eulogia is married, is 49 years old and has 8 children. Eulogia travels to the various markets in the region selling clothing and buying grains that she later processes into flour and sells in the Ayacuchan forrest. Eulogia needs a loan of 1200 Soles to invest in the purchase of clothing. Eulogia dreams of educating her children and buying a computer for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jassem

texts.en: Jassem is a 38-year-old married man and father of 3 children. He has been working as a constructor since 2001 to earn income and provide better life conditions to his family.  Today, Jassem is applying for a loan of $1,000 to renovate his business tools.

loans.use: renovate his business tools

loans.name: Good Sababu Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu B. and Chernor H. J. of the Good Sababu Group. They are local entrepreneurs in Kabala town, northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are seeking for loans of Le 800,000 for each to enable them improve their businesses, make more sales and improve on the amount of profit they make. With the profit they will make, they will be able to better support their schools going children, feed them and meet most of their numerous household problems. 

Isatu B. on the left is the leader of the group. Isatu was born in Kabala town and she is forty years of age. She is married to a farmer and they have five children together. Isatu sells a number of items including cigarettes, matches, soaps, pastes, pens, milks, biscuits, gums, palm-oil and many more. Isatu has been a businesswoman for ten years, and thanks to SMT/Kiva loans, her business has experienced vast improvements over the years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer muy luchadora, a pesar de tener 59 años no se detiene en la vida y sola ha sacado adelante a su único hijo (José), que tiene 40 años y con quien vive en un populoso distrito al sur de la ciudad. No ha sido fácil pero lo ha logrado con esfuerzo y dedicación, y aún trabaja para seguir saliendo adelante.

Desde hace 6 años se levanta muy temprano a preparar desayunos en una cafetería que tiene dentro de una empresa. A diario debe atender a muchos comensales y también en el local vende diferentes productos, como golosinas y gaseosas; y ya en la tarde, ofrece almuerzo a sus clientes. Ella casi no descansa porque le gusta mucho su trabajo y la entretiene, además de darle buenas ganancias económicas. Y como a veces no se abastece sola en el negocio, es por eso que le ayuda una sobrina, sobretodo en las mañanas cuando hay más gente.
Es así que piensa ampliar el negocio, surtirlo con más productos que dejen satisfechos a sus clientes para obtener más ganancias económicas que le permitan tener una buena calidad de vida y ayudar a sus nietos.

Aunque es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que debe ser puntual y así lo ha sido siempre, es por eso que ha podido salir adelante criando a su único hijo. Ella conoce muy bien a las integrantes de su banco comunal y está satisfecha porque todas son mujeres luchadoras como ella. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio y crecer aun más en la vida, porque para ella “cada día es un día nuevo”.
texts.en:
Hilda is a strong-willed woman. Despite being 59 years old, she does not let age prevent her from having a life. Hilda is motivated to succeed by her only son José, who is 40 years old and lives in a populous district in the southern part of the city. Things have not been easy for her, but she perseveres with great effort and dedication. She continues working in order to move forward.

For six years, Hilda has been waking up early to prepare breakfast in her café that is situated next to another business. She serves many people on a daily basis and also sells other products from her establishment, such as candy and soft drinks. In the afternoons, she offers lunch to her customers. Hilda takes very little rest because she enjoys her work so much and finds it both entertaining and profitable. Most of the time she works alone, but sometimes her niece comes by to help in the mornings when there are more people. Hilda has plans to expand her business and restock it with more supplies so that her customers leave satisfied. Additional revenue would provide her a good quality of life and enable her to help her grandchildren.

Even though this will be her first loan with MFP, Hilda knows that she must make her payments on time. She has demonstrated she is responsible by successfully raising her only son. Hilda is well known among the other members of her Communal Bank and fits in with the rest of the group because they are all fighters just like her. The money she requested will be used to buy more merchandise for her business. She hopes to grow even more in life, because for her “every day is a new day.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise for her inventory

loans.name: Bdec Home Economics Group

texts.en:
These women are staff members of the Primary School in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. The school was opened to offer supplementary education in and around Makeni. The school is staffed with twelve teachers, all of whom are females. (One teacher who was unable to make the original photo has been added in the lower left corner.)

They teach older pupils who are already in classes five and six from all schools in Makeni and beyond. Each school in town will bring their pupils this school on a fixed day of the week for lessons. Among the subjects they teach are: home management; child care; Family and Life Education (F.L.E.); agriculture; clothing and textiles; food and nutrition, and so on. 

This is the second loan this school is borrowing from SMT (Kiva). With this loan, they will be able to do something meaningful. Gradually, they will repay it out of their meager monthly salaries. Teachers are among the lowest paid workers in Sierra Leone, and with such small salaries, they cannot do or buy anything great. With a loan, some of them can buy pieces of furniture;  some will pay either their children’s school fees or pay for themselves to pursue further studies; others will use theirs to either start building a house or complete the building process; and others will use theirs in business to supplement their monthly salaries. 

Hellen (second from right) is the head teacher at the school. She is forty-nine years of age, married with three children. Helen will use her loan to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Various items for different women, school fees for leader

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Rubén Gómez es un señor que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos y de su esposa es por ello que trabaja horas extras para darles una mejor calidad de vida. El ha ido construyendo su casa con prestamos de aquí y ahorros propios.
Ahora una de sus hijas ya esta grande en el que el le hizo un cuarto aparte para ella el que tenga su privacidad. Rubén  quiere que su hija se sienta bien en su nueva recama es por ello que quiere ponerle vitropiso para que se vea bonito y su hija se sienta orgullosa del padre que tiene.
texts.en:
Rubén Gómez is a gentleman who is concerned about the well-being of his wife and children, and it's for this reason he works extra hours to give them a better quality of life. He has been building his home with loans from here and personal savings. Now that one of his daughters is grown up, he built her a separate bedroom so that she could have some privacy. Rubén wants his daughter to feel comfortable in her new room, and it's for this reason he wants to put in ceramic tiles so it looks beautiful and so his daughter feels proud of him.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put cermatic tile flooring in his home

loans.name: Truly Group

texts.en: Theresa is 51 years old. She is a widow and has given birth to five children. Her children are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The major occupation of the people is in the fishing industry. Theresa is a caterer. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Truly. The members of the group are mainly in the fishing business and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Theresa, the group leader, is second from the right in the photograph. It is the group's desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Mrs. Babita B. lives with her husband and one son, who has attained grade 9. Her husband’s name is Pradeep B..

Both Mr. and Mrs. B. have been doing tailoring work, which they learned from their forefathers. They make school uniforms for both boys and girls. They prefer to make popular ladies clothes, like kurta sulwal, blouses, long dresses, and other clothes.

Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of Rs 25000.00 loan to buy raw materials like cotton cloth for the tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich C. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Now Mrs. Pich C. wants to improve her standard of living and increase her income. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support her field. Mrs. Pich C. is 53 years old and she lives in Angkunh village in Takeo province. She is a widow with three children. Two of her children are waiters in a restaurant and the other is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a cow and fertilizer

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamuna T. is a shopkeeper in the town of Chetrapati, Kathmandu. She opened her grocery store six years ago as a way to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of items, including rice, maize and snacks.

Competition is tougher than it used to be because there are now lots of grocery stores near hers. To stay in business, Mrs. Jamuna needs to sell goods cheaply, and that means investing money in her store. That is why she is requesting a loan to improve her store.

Mrs. Jamuna is married and has three children, all of whom are still in school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth B., 35, is from the village of Lower lodiong Tambulig Zambo, Sur. She is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ruth is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish in the local communities. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ruth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and save for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ide Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, la señora Ide H. se dedica a diario a atender su negocio de venta de ropa ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

Actualmente ella está solicitando un crédito que será invertido en la compra de piezas tales como camiseta, calcetines, blusas, entre otros. Ella espera que dicho crédito le sea otorgado para comercializar la ropa y así generar ingresos para su negocio y familia.
texts.en:
Ide H. sells all kinds of clothes for women, men and children in her business in Managua's Mayoreo market. She is asking for funds to buy articles of clothing like: t-shirts, socks, blouses, among others. She hopes the loan will be approved so that she can sell the clothes and continue thereby to generate income for her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette D. pratique une double activité  de vente d’haricot et  tomate comme activité primaire et de pain comme activité  secondaire. Elle est âgée de 37 ans et habite dans la localité  de Bambilor. Elle est mariée  et mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 7 mois et 15 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis janvier 2010. Elle a plus de 15 ans d’expérience dans son activité. C’est juste après  son mariage qu’elle a commence à s’occuper pour éviter une dépendance totale envers son mari. Et elle a trouve son activité assez importante dans la mesure où  elle lui permet de satisfaire une partie de ses besoins. Elle emprunte une somme de 50 000 frs qui sera utilise pour l’achat de haricots, de tomates et de pomme de terre destines a la vente. Ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire d’avantage ses besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette D. sells green beans and tomatoes as her main activity and bread as a secondary activity. She is 37 years old and lives in Bambilor. She is married and has six children whose ages vary between seven months and 15 years. She has been a member of the Bambilor credit loan group since January 2010. She has acquired over 15 years’ experience in her business, which she started just after getting married, to avoid becoming entirely dependent upon her husband. She finds that her activity is rather important in that she can satisfy part of her needs. She is borrowing 50,000 francs which will serve to buy green beans, tomatoes and potatoes for resale. This loan will allow her to satisfy a larger portion of her family’s needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her working capital

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a 28-year-old mother of two children aged 8 and 4 years old. Her husband is a driver and they live in Hoima, Uganda in a rented house with a family of five dependants. Both of them share the responsibilities for their family's welfare. Doreen has a salon she operates and has five years of experience in the business. This, she says, is her first job and business and she dreams of starting a cosmetics shop in addition to improving her salon. This is her 11th loan from HOFOKAM and she will use the loan funds to buy braids and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.use: To buy braids and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Miroslava

texts.en:
Miroslava is divorced and is a single mom raising a 3 1/2-year-old son. Miroslava lives in Belaya Tserkov. She is co-owner of a pharmacy called “Family Pharmacist” selling various types of medication, personal hygiene products and nutritional supplements. Her pharmacy has 66,000 UAH worth of inventory. Miroslava can be characterized as a smart and determined entrepreneur. She is an achiever and always tries to accomplish her goals.

Miroslava is very health conscious. She understands the importance of fresh products that are offered for sale in grocery stores. She would like to open a dairy kiosk offering fresh and quality products to her community. Miroslava is seeking a 10,000 UAH loan to buy a small vending facility next to her pharmacy and to launch this startup.

loans.use: to open a dairy vending kiosk

loans.name: Lote

texts.en:
Lote F. is 36 and married with 2 children (ages 9 and 10).  She owns a business venture, selling donuts.  Lote has 3 years of experience in this business.  Lote needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Lote joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lote's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Miriam es una mujer emprendedora, de 47 años de edad, madre de dos hijos. Su negocio es una sastrería que  se hacen todo tipo de costura para dama, caballeros, niños, y una variedad como: cortina, ropa de cama, fundas, manteles. Este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, y trabaja junto con su esposo ya que es sastres y ambos se han apoyado en el trabajo. 
Inicio desde joven, a trabajar, pues las condiciones económicas no eran tan buenas. Gracias a su mama logro sobresalir y pudo aprender la costura. Con este financiamiento comprara materia prima como: telas variadas, hilos, botones, bordados para lograr hacer los trabajos de costura que espera lograr mejores resultados en ventas ya que hay día que están bajas. 
Es por eso hará la inversión para elaborar costura nueva, y captar clientes nuevo y lograr equilibrar sus costos y gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Miriam is an enterprising woman who is 47 years old and the mother of two children. She works as a tailor making all types of clothing for women, men, and children, as well as a variety of other items such as curtains, bed sheets, pillowcases, and tablecloths. Miriam started her business several years ago and works with her husband. Since they are both tailors, they are both supportive of each other’s work. She started working as a young woman because her economic situation was not that good. Thanks to her mother, Miriam was able to get ahead and learn sewing.

This loan will be used to buy raw materials such as various fabrics, thread, buttons, and fringe so that she can continue producing apparel. She hopes to achieve better results with her sales since they are low at the moment. With this investment to produce new clothing, she hopes to attract new customers and achieve balance with her costs and expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen P., age 23, is from the village of Malasin. She and her husband have a baby. To make a living, Gretchen prepares and sells cooked food items for daily meals. Gretchen has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Gretchen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Gretchen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Gretchen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Gretchen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the offerings of her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
la sra. Doris P. G. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la produccion y venta de productos lacteos, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. su producto lo vende en Guasaule y Triunfo.
 estos lacteos los vende en grandes cantidades ya que le hacen pedidos de comedores.
se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo cada dia mas, en estos momentos no cumple con las necesidades de sus clientes. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas leche y materiales para la fabricacion de los lacteos.
Doris vende Queso, quesillo, cuajada y mantequilla.
texts.en:
Doris P. G. is an enterprising woman who makes and sells dairy products. She has been doing this type of work for a number of years, and she sells her products in Guasale and Triunfo. She sells her dairy products in large quantities, since she sells to dining establishments through orders. She feels very happy that her business is growing larger each day; she is not currently able to meet all of her customers needs. She will use this loan to buy more milk and materials to make her dairy products. Doris sells a variety of types of cheeses and also butter.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cow's milk

loans.name: Tamara's Group

texts.en:
Tamara S. is the leader of the group. She is 44 years old and divorced. She has raised five sons and a daughter. Three sons work in her sewing workshop and the other children study at school.

Ten years ago with an initial investment of 50,000 soms, Tamara opened a sewing workshop. She works there with her sons. By taking orders and selling different clothes, Tamara makes 18,000 soms per month.

She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase fabric and materials for sewing the clothes. In the future, Tamara plans to purchase more sewing machines to expand her business and buy a flat for each son.

Gulmira T., 43 years old, is married. She has a son who is six years old and a student. In order to make money, Gulmira’s husband works in construction. Five years ago, Gulmira borrowed 20,000 soms from her sister and started to sell fruits and vegetables at the market. Today, by selling fruits and vegetables, she makes 17,000 soms per month. With money received from this loan, Gulmira wants to purchase various fruits and vegetables in order to resell them. In the future, she wants to build a store, and adopt a girl from an orphanage.

Aaly A., 46 years old, is married. He has two daughters and a son. His older daughter works as baker in Bishkek, his son is a waiter in Russia, and his second daughter studies in school. Seventeen years ago with an initial investment of 30,000 soms, Aaly started selling fruits and vegetables. He makes 18,200 soms per month. With the money received from this loan, he wants to purchase fruits in order to resell them at a higher price. In the future, he wants to contribute some money to his daughter’s wedding and to purchase a flat for his son.

Taalaikul J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 33 years old and married. She has two sons and a daughter. In order to make money, her husband works as driver and Taalaikul sells convenience goods in a kiosk. She has been doing this for eight years. Taalaikul started with an initial investment of 10,000 soms and now she makes 11,000 soms per month. With money received from this loan, she wants to purchase various goods to resell in her kiosk. In the future, she wants to build a big store and purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Buyanhuu

texts.en:
Buyanhuu H. is 54 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of Buyanhuu’s children are students while her husband works as a carpenter in their town. 

Buyanhuu operates a dairy product retail business in her town at the local market. She began her business in 1995 and attributes her business success to her knowledge of local market demands. She is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products to sell during the upcoming winter months when prices for such products traditionally rise.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida I. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Catarman I, Cordova, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 5 business ventures: a Sari-Sari (General) Store, Ready to Wear (RTW), Electronic Re-loading, Water Vending and another retailing business. Her husband, Arnel I., who is 39 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living. They have 2 children who are 16 and 20 years old.

Leonida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leonida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000 which she intends to use for additional funds for her business. Her goals are to continue to save for the future, let her children finish their studies and to expand the businesses.

Leonida I. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. (Dungganon is a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable.) Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional funds for her businesses

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es:
Walter es casado con la Sra. Yesenia Cerna con quien tiene un niño de 3 años de edad de nombre Walter, su esposa trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Don Walter trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como auxiliar de maquinaria pesada desde hace 10 años.

Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de embaldosar los cuartos y la sala y si el dinero lo permite comprar las puertas de su casa y posteriormente habitarla, ya que actualmente vive en casa de su papá.  

El mayor sueño de Walter es poder contar con una vivienda digna y comoda para su familia, ya que desea que su hijo crezca en un hogar propio construido con el esfuerzo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Walter is married with Mrs. Yesenia Cerna and together they have a little boy, 3 years old, named Walter. His wife works and contributes towards the household expenses. Walter has worked as a heavy machinery operator for the past 10 years for the city of Juigalpa. He requests a third loan to finish the walls of the bedrooms and the living room, and if there are enough funds he will also purchase doors for the house, to be able to move in afterwards. They currently live in his father's house. Walter's greatest dream is to have a dignified and comfortable house for his family. He wants his son to grow up in a house owned by them and built through his parents' efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish a room and purchase doors.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco reside en el Departamento de San Miguel, tiene 36 años y vive junto a su esposa y tres hijas quienes dependen económicamente de francisco y su esposa, él se dedica a pintar y hace rótulos de publicidad, su esposa vende pupusas y juntos ven la forma para que no falte en su hogar la alimentación.
Francisco atiende el negocio desde las siete de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde junto a un ayudante, ese negocio es el único en la zona por lo que francisco no tiene competencia por el momento.
Él necesita remodelar su negocio ampliándolo y construyendo una oficina pero no cuenta con  los fondos necesarios, por lo que solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento del local. Esto ayudara tener mejor atracción de parte de los clientes y les dará mejor servicio ya que estarán mas cómodos en un local mejor organizado y de esta manera Francisco aumentara el número de clientes y mejoraran sus ingresos.
Sus proyecciones a futuro son tener un mejor local, contar con más clientes, mejorar la atención a quienes le visiten, ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
