Francisco lives in the Salvadoran department of San Miguel. He is 36 years old and lives with his wife and their three children, who are still economically dependent on them. He paints and makes signs. His wife sells pupusas, a Salvadoran snack. Between the two of them, they make sure their family is well fed. Francisco works from seven in the morning until six in the evening and has one assistant. His business is the only one in the area, which means that for the moment he has no competition. Francisco needs to remodel his business, expanding the space and building an office, but he doesn't have the money needed so he's requested a loan to carry out the improvements. This will help him attract more customers and give them better service, since they'll be more comfortable in a better organized space. In this way, Francisco hopes to expand his customer base and increase his income. His plans for the future are to have a better space and more customers, improve service for those who come to him, and help improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodelar el negocio ampliándolo y construyendo una oficina

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is from the village of Lucsson Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Elizabeth is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products like rice and corn grits, canned goods, instant noodles, bagoong and dried fish in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Elizabeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Goma K..  She is married and has three children, aged 26, 22 and 17.  In 1998, she established her cow-raising business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family. In the future, Goma plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  

The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice T.  is currently in the business of selling fish, tomatoes and beans and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Joice is 27 years old and married to a businessman. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elba; La socia tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es casada  y tiene 8 hijos, la socia se dedica a la artesanía, ella trabaja con artesanía desde hace 25 años, la socia tiene su pequeño stand y vende todo tipo de arte, desde llaveros, adornos de cerámica, ceniceros, vasos, porta lapiceros, lapiceros con motivos de cholitas, títeres andinos y ella también elabora muñecas de trapo con trajes típicos de la zona andina.  La socia desea invertir en la compra de mercadería de tipo artesanal, ella tiene sus proveedores y también comprará chalinas hechas en oveja y lana de alpaca bebe. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elba belongs to the “Sacsayhuaman” Communal Bank, located in the district of Huanchac, department and province of Cusco.

Elba is 55 years old, married, and has 8 children.  She has been an artisan for some 25 years and she has a little stand where she sells all types of art, including key rings, ceramic decorations, ash trays, glasses, pencil holders, mechanical pencils with peasant decorations, Andean puppets, and she makes rag dolls with typical Andean clothing.

Elba wishes to invest in buying merchandise of the artisan type.  She has her own suppliers and, also, she wants to buy scarves made from the wool of sheep and baby alpacas.

Elba appreciates and values the loans available through this medium and, at the same time, she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO BUY ARTISAN MERCHANDISE FOR HER STAND

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pepper, palm oil, rice and salt

loans.name: Wafaa'

texts.en:
Wafa’a is a struggling woman from Marka- Amman.  She is 36 years old and a mother of five.

Years ago, Wafa’a started her business using her own savings; she opened a small grocery shop where she worked with her husband, who was distributing goods using his bus.

Wafa’a is requesting a loan of 2000 JD to decorate her store and buy additional goods.

loans.use: To decorate her store and buy additional goods

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and three young children, who are attending school. She helps her husband to satisfy the family's income needs. Her husband sells car spare parts. Since 2004, she's owned a clothes store, buying her products from a local clothing center. She always tries to be up-to-date with the market and new designs to attract a good number of clients.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional products for her store so that she can gratify her customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old widow. She is from Lebanon. She lives with her 3 young children some of whom are attending school. After her husband’s death she had to work hard each day to handle her family’s expenses. In 2008, she opened a small clothing store and started to offer her customers a limited variety of clothes. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her business operation and purchase more merchandise so she can serve her customers better. She is very optimistic about her future and intent on providing her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business operation and purchase more products

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso (Manta) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela María Auxiliadora de la hermosa ciudad de Manta, conocida por sus bellas playas que son muy visitada por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se reúnen cada quince días los socios del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Progreso. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, a la prestación de servicios y a la pesca. Ellos hace un tiempo atrás unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y están muy contentos ya que a través de los créditos han podido financiar sus negocios.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Estrella, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 6 y 4 años, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en el Camal Municipal de Manta.
 
Se dedica a la venta de productos Avon, Lebel, Sayson (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además también vende ropa y artículos para el hogar (planchas, licuadoras, tostadoras, entre otras) a través de cartillas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, ella deja a crédito sus productos y cobra lo que es perfumes cobra en dos partes y los productos para el hogar cada semana, nos cuenta que lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien y mucho mejor le ha ido desde que realizo el primer crédito.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas, artículos para el hogar y ropa. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos, es la presidenta del Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda a ella y a sus compañeras. Su sueño es ver que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujeres En Progreso (Women in Progress) communal bank meet every two weeks in the María Auxiliadora neighborhood in the beautiful city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited by local and foreign tourists alike.  Said members have a variety of activities like general commerce, services and fishing.  Some time ago they combined their efforts to access Fundación Espoir’s benefits.  This is their third cycle in the communal bank and they are very happy because through the loans they have been able to finance their businesses.

We found Estrella, 30, in this place.  She is in a common law relationship and has three children who are 9, 6 and 4 years of age.  The two oldest are in school.  Her husband works at the Manta Municipal Slaughterhouse.

She sells Avon, L’Bel and Sayson products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She also sells clothes and articles for the home (irons, blenders, toasters, among others) via savings books.  She works daily from 8:30 until 5:00.  She sells door to door and on order.  She sells on credit and collects on perfumes in two payments and on the home articles weekly.  She tells us that she’s been in this line of work for several years and has done very well, much better still since she took out her first loan.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, articles for the home and clothes.  She has been in the communal bank for three cycles.  She is the bank President and she likes it because of the help it provides her and her fellow members.  Her dream is to see her children attain a good education.

loans.use: To buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, articles for the home and clothes.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She cultivates her land where she plants and harvests rice crops. Delia sells her harvest to their community. She is planning to put up a sari-sari (variety) store in front of their house. Right now, she is starting small by displaying products like oil and toothpaste outside her house. Delia does her best to feed, clothe and send her children to school.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
Lilias S. is currently in the business of selling fish. 

She is a 30-year-old widow with three children, and none of them goes to school. 

Lilias borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. They own a house that has piped water but no electricity. He has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years, selling in a shop to local residents. 

Eric dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for sale. Eric decided to join Yehu to gain knowledge on business ideas.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson M. is a married man and has four children between the ages of seventeen and three.  He hopes to give them a good education to the university level.  Samson's business is located in  the busy Ngara area in Nairobi. He sells charcoal to the local people. He has been in this business for twelve years and has managed to employ one person. Samson says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Samson is using his loan of 70,000 to buy stocks of charcoal to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future diversify into the transport business, having bought himself a matatu.  Samson describes himself as determined, devoted and caring.

loans.use: purchase more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Milagros; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también trabaja como guía de turismo, ella en su tienda de abarrotes atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of the "SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Milagros is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She also works as a tourist guide.  Milagros serves in her grocery store from 6.00am to 10.00pm and, through her business, she gets her child ahead in life.  Milagros would like to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting a loan to buy essentials.

Milagros is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy essentials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy medical equipment and medicine

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 23 years old, and he is married with two children who are ages 1 1/2  and 3 years old. His wife is a farmer. He owns a bar in which they sell different kinds of beer, soft drinks such as sodas, and he also sells a few foodstuffs.This business has enabled him develop his standards of living. J. Damascene is requesting a loan to buy more beer,sodas and some foodstuffs in order to make more profits.His is planning to expand his business.

loans.use: purchase beer, soft drinks and foodstuffs to resell.

loans.name: Janifer

texts.en: Janifer is 35 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 3 of them go to school.  Manifer sells charcoal.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.en:
Maria Salome is 41 years old and lives in Tulcán, a city in northern Ecuador that is located on the border with Colombia. She is a single mother of two children, a daughter who is 22 years old and a son who is 17. She says she will do anything in her power to take care of her children.

Raising animals is an activity that Maria Salome has always liked. She buys and sells pigs at the livestock market to support her family. This is her first loan, and it will go towards the purchase of pigs.

With the help of a loan, Maria Salome hopes that she will be able to buy things for her family that they were never able to afford before. In the future she'd like to expand her market for pigs and provide her children with college educations.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is a married woman with two children. She is 59 years old and has had a buy-and-sell business for 20 years. Juana sells items like nipa — a palm used for thatching or making baskets. She usually earns about 8,000 PHP per month with her business. She is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP to buy more nipa to sell. In the future, she hopes her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy more nipa to sell

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is a 28 year-old woman who breeds and sells sheep.  Gulnar is married and a loving mother of three children.  Gulnar works hard because she wants to improve her life. She is engaged in animal husbandry. Her husband repairs different kind of electronics and he helps his wife in his free time.
For the past 4 years, this persevering lady has been working very hard raising and selling sheep. She uses the income she generates to provide a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy.  With two previous loans she was able to increase her income.

Gulnar has requested a loan of 1100 AZN to buy fodder and more lambs that she will sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, she will be able to increase her earnings substantially and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase 10 lambs and fodder

loans.name: Luis Abelardo

texts.es: El Sra.  Luis es   una persona  muy trabajadora  que  día   con día  se preocupa  por el  patrimonio de  su  familia la  cual representa  lo mas importante  en su  vida, en esta  ocasión  el  requiere  de  nuestro  apoyo   ya  que  desea  realizar  algunos  arreglos  a   su  hogar   ya  que  su casa  no  cuenta  con  cielo  falso y por el  momento no dispone del presupuesto  necesario  para   hacerle  frente  a este  gasto, agradece  de  antemano  el  apoyo  brindado  para  realizar  su  sueño.
texts.en: Señor Luis is a hard-working person. He worries daily about his family's welfare which is the most important thing in his life.  Right now he is in need of our support as he wants to makes some repairs to his house.  His house doesn't have a ceiling and he doesn't have the necessary funds to cover this expense.  He is grateful in advance for the support given to make his dream come true.

loans.use: put a ceiling in his home.

loans.name: Siguitemasson Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe SIGUITEMASSON II sont mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce  prêt, OUMOU première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Siguitemasson II group are all married women , on the average 33 years of age, with five children. They live in polygamous families in the town of Banco, the main locality of a rural community in Doila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region, the second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the goal of better managing their work at the beginning of the winter season. They cultivate rice and peanuts [ground nuts], among others. They are on their first collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this loan, OUMOU, the first person seated on the left, plans to buy farm inputs [such as fertilizers] and small tools and pay the cost of labor to work about 0.5 ha [about 1.25 acres] of rice and peanuts.

After harvesting, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou to a customer base composed of both men and women. They group members plan to achieve an average income of 25,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor,  seeds,  fertilizer, herbicide and small tools

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es: Don Ubaldo tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y tiene una hija mujer y un hijo varon, y junto a ellos reside en la Comunidad de Las Vegas en el Municipio de Trojes. Don Ubaldo y su familia se dedican al cultivo de café, tambien poseen una pequeña pulperia y en pequeña escala al cultivo de plátano y maiz. Èl es un señor humilde y muy trabajador. Inició a sembrar café hace 12 años, y lo aprendió por su familia, tiene algunos trabajadores que le ayudan con las labores de la finca y él y su hijo tambien se suman a las tareas. Su horario de trabajo inicia a las 6:00 am y finaliza a las 12:00 pm. La ventaja del cultivo de café es que es un producto básico de exportación y muy importante en el país. La desventaja es que en muchas ocasiones Don Ubaldo no ha vendido su producto al precio que deberia por el desmedido descontrol de intermediarios no legales que quieren comprar el producto a un precio super bajo y luego llevarselo a otros paises para venderlo hasta cinco veces mas caro de como lo compraron, tambien debe enfrentarse a que en tiempo de cosecha la mano de obra es escaza y eso le ha provocado algunas perdidas, pero con todo y eso Don Ubaldo siempre ha seguido adelante sin dejarse vencer. El prestamo que esta solicitando lo necesita para la fertilizacion y limpia de 6 mz de cultivo. Con el apoyo del prestamo su cultivo mejorara ya que la fertilizacion de la tierra se hará oportunamente y las condiciones de vida de su familia seran mejores. Don Ubaldo tiene dos ciclos en FAMA y no ha tenido atrasos en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Don Ubaldo is 52 years old, married and has one daughter and one son. Together with them he resides in the Las Vegas community of the municipality of Trojes. Don Ubaldo and his family devote themselves to growing coffee, and also have a small grocery store, as well as growing bananas and corn on a small scale. He is a humble and very hardworking man. He began growing coffee 12 years ago and learned it from his family. He has some laborers who help him with the work on the farm, and he and his son also join in on the efforts. His work schedule begins at 6 a.m. and ends at 12 p.m. The advantage to coffee growing is that it is a primary product for exportation and very important to the country. The disadvantage is that often Don Ubaldo has not sold his product at the price he should have, because of the out-of-control actions of illegal middlemen who want to buy the product at a super low price and then take it to other countries, where they sell it for as much as five times more than they paid for it. 

He also must deal with the fact that at harvest time labor is scarce, and this has caused him some losses, but in spite of everything, Don Ubaldo has always kept going without giving up. He needs the loan he is seeking for fertilizing and clearing over ten acres of farmland. With the support of the loan he will improve his crops, since the fertilization of the soil will be done at an appropriate time, and his family's living conditions will be improved. Don Ubaldo has two cycles with FAMA and has not been behind on any of his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for coffee farming.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
Zareena has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her livestock business. She operates this business and currently has two goats. She purchases the goats from animal markets and sells them for a profit after raising them. With the loan, she will buy a buffalo to start a milk-selling business. The milk business is in great demand in her community and people earn good profits from this business. 

She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her eldest daughter is studying while the others are not of school-going age yet. She is very confident that after the loan investment, she will be able to establish her milk-selling business and makes it profitable as well.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zareena.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to start a milk-selling business

loans.name: Marchie

texts.en:
Marchie is a single lady. She is 29 years old and lives in the village of Gata Daku in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Marchie helps her family members in financing and working on their business of planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has spent three years of her life doing this kind of job. She is also working in a private company and earns just enough to cover personal and other minor expenses. At the end of the month, she earns approximately PHP 10,000.  She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 at GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.
 
Marchie has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. This is her fourth loan cycle in the cooperative. 

In the future, Marchie hopes for a good return of investment and to gain more income for the family. She further plans to own a condominium that could be a source of income and to become stable financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Kidubuli Banana Famers S &c Group

texts.en: Rose is a 48-year-old married woman with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop dealing in general merchandise such as soap, sugar, and other items. Her major problem has been price fluctuations of products. Rose's dream is to have a wholesale shop and to educate her children. Rose needs the loan to buy soap and sugar for resale.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 42 años de edad, es casado con cuatro hijos.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, y fue su papá quien le enseño este trabajo, don José siembra maíz y se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. a darle de comer a sus animales, luego se va a trabajar durante ocho horas desplazándose en su bicicleta aproximadamente cuatro kilómetros.

Los cultivos necesitan fertilizantes, para que puedan dar una buena producción, por lo que don José se traslada a la ciudad, para esto se desplaza en su bicicleta de su casa hasta la carretera principal que son seis kilómetros, para abordar un bus, la bicicleta la deja en una casa, mientras el viaja hasta la ciudad en busca de los insumos que necesita.

El señor José solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar fertilizantes y herbicidas, de esta manera podrá obtener una buena cosecha de maíz. La cual le servirá para obtener mejores ingresos para su familia y tendrá alimento para su ganado.

Con los ingresos, él tiene planeado cambiar las puertas de su casa de adobe, ya que estas son de palma de coco y él desea hacerlas de madera. Don José quiere comprar más ganado y poder producir más leche y generar mayores ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
José, age 42, is married and has four children.  He has been farming since he was very little; his father was the one who taught him this work.  José grows corn.  He gets up at 5:00 a.m. to feed his animals.  He then goes to work for eight hours traveling approximately four kilometers on his bike.

The crops need fertilizers in order to be able to give a good production.  José consequently travels to the city.  To do this he goes on his bike from his house to the main road, which is six kilometers, to get on a bus.  He leaves his bike at a house while he travels to the city looking for the supplies he needs.

José is requesting a loan from the Fundación Campo in order to buy fertilizers and herbicides.  This way he will be able to get a good harvest of corn.  This will serve him to get better income for his family, and he will have food for his livestock.

With his earnings he plans to change the doors to his adobe house.  The doors are coconut palms, and he wishes to make them from wood.  José wants to buy more livestock and to be able to produce more milk.  He wants to do this to generate more income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his corn crop.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Edna has a shop that sells home products like plates, spoons, and casseroles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy products like casseroles, spoons, and plates for resale.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy prodcuts like casseroles, spoons, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.ru: Абдувахоб проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат. Имеет шестерых детей. У него среднее образование. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области он 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух бычков.
texts.en: Abduvahob lives in the Rudaki district.  He is 46 years old, married and has six children.  He has a secondary education.  Abduvahob earns a living by breeding cattle and primarily breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of two bulls.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls

loans.name: Gbenan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENAN est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier  au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sidonie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sidonie est âgée de 37 ans et est  mariée à un conducteur du nom de Edmond. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sidonie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Sidonie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis neuf ans, Sidonie vend des charbons de bois et des plateaux d’œufs. Ce qui lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Sidonie désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Sidonie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENAN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The GBENAN group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's leader, Sidonie, has her hand raised in the photo.
This is the first time that the group has asked for financial help from ALIDé in order to increase the level of their activity. 

Sidonie is 37 years old and married to a driver named Edmond. The couple has 2 children, both of them are in their care and go to school. Sidonie lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household expenses. Sidonie did not go to school. For the past nine years, she has been selling charcoal and trays of eggs. This allows her to easily contribute to her family's needs. In an effort to better meet her customers' demand, Sidonie wants to increase her stock and boost the level of her activity. To do this, she is requesting, along with the other members of the GBENAN group, her first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and trays of eggs.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
MARCELINA:
Doña Marcelina, es una mujer con el deseo de superarse y sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos aunque solo tenga 2 pequeñitos, desde hace 9 años que su esposo falleció su vida cambio rotundamente, ya que tuvo que velar por sus hijos que gracias a Dios al día de hoy son quienes le brindan un ingreso para sus hermanos pequeños, fue de esta manera  en la que ella vio la necesidad de buscar la manera de ganarse un ingreso para sus hijos, empezó con la venta de ropa típica con algunas conocidas quienes la apoyaron, ahora ya logra tener un poco en  sus ventas, también se dedica a ayudar en oficios domésticos a sus vecinas, siempre al tanto de su pequeño negocio, por lo que requiere de capital para invertir un poco mas en la compra de ropa tipica para la venta ya  que le solicitan sus clientes y ella nos tiene ella quiere ver crecer a sus hijos y brindarles todo lo posible para que ellos estudien y se preparen para la vida.
texts.en:
MARCELINA:

Marcelina is a woman who very much wants to improve herself and raise her six children even though just two of them are still little.  Nine years ago her husband died and her life changed radically because she had to see after her children.  Thanks to God it’s now they who provide her with income for their little siblings.  It was in this way that she saw the need to find a way to earn income for her children.  She started selling traditional clothing to some acquaintances that helped her out.  She is able now to earn a little from her sales.  She also does domestic chores for her neighbors always watching over her small business though.  This is why she needs capital to invest a bit more in traditional clothing to sell because her customers request items that she does not have.  She wants to see her children grow up and provide them with everything possible so that they can go to school and prepare themselves for life.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a single woman with one child who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With her KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mete

texts.en: Mete is 29 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with three children between 10 and 15 years old. They are in school and live at home. Mete has been selling ladies' handbags and slippers for the past ten years.  She started this business with money given to her by her mother, and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ladies' handbags and slippers for her business. In future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' handbags and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en:
Paskali is a forty-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for the last ten years and his major hardships are: price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase spraying chemicals. He has as an objective to hire employees to help expand his farming activities. 

The purpose of the loan is to weed his plantation and buy spraying chemicals for his garden.

loans.use: to weed his plantation and buy spraying chemicals for his garden.

loans.name: Ilsia Evelyn

texts.es:
Ilsia, de nuevo solicita un préstamo por la necesidad de invirtir en su negocio de tortillas y comprar la materia prima que necesita como: maíz, gas, leña, ya que hoy en dia a parte de la sastreria se dedica a vender tortillas, este oficio lo ha iniciado hace poco, porque es una manera de intentar ganar mas dinero, también ella quiere terminar una fosa de aguas negras y comprar cañería, cemento, arena, para finalizar la construccion y a si podrá vivir en mejores condiciones de vida.
Los financiamientos anteriores le ayudaron porque hizo algunas compras de materiales para la sastreria, dando un mejor servicio a los clientes y las condiciones de vida de su familia mejoraron.
texts.en: Ilsia is once again asking for a loan to invest in her tortilla business and to buy the raw materials she needs like: corn, gas and firewood since she now uses part of the tailor shop to sell tortillas.  She started this business a short time go because it’s a way to generate extra income and she also wants to finish building a septic tank and to buy tubing, cement and sand to finish building it to live in better conditions.  Previous loans helped her because she bought some supplies for her tailor shop thus providing better customers service and her family’s living conditions improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and gas.

loans.name: Selna

texts.en: Selna is a sari-sari store owner who lives in the town of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married with three children. The oldest child is 17 years old while the youngest child is 10 years old. With her eagerness to help her husband she starts her own business. And she was operating this store for 22 years. Selna is a 42-year-old woman who dreams of business improvement. Thus, she wanted to improve her business to have enough money to send all her children to college. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as snack foods, candies, toiletries, coffee, sugar, salt, spices, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, food seasoning, canned goods and drinks. In this way, she will be able to improve her store and augment her earnings.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, candies, toiletries, coffee, sugar, salt, spices, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, food seasoning, canned goods and drinks

loans.name: Veliyeddin

texts.en:
Veliyeddin has rented this hairdressing saloon for 13 years. He is 52, married, has 3 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbajar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. In the beginning of his business, he borrowed a loan of $300 and bought equipments for his hairdressing saloon. 
The second loan he spent to repair his hairdressing saloon. 
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy this salon.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing saloon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eva wants to buy a dairy cow and a tank of water.

loans.name: Vefa

texts.en: Cafarova Vefa is 38. She is an internally dislocated person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh. She lives in Bilasuvar City. To cover her five children's basic needs, she has applied for a loan of US$ 1200 from Aqroinvest CU. With that sum, she intends to purchase one cow and a calf.

loans.use: To buy 1 cow and calf

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Ms. Estela is married and has three children. Her husband, Fredy A., is 38 years old. He is a factory employee and they live in a house in the center of the city. Since her husband’s income was not enough to support the family, she decided to make handiwork objects to sell. Thanks to previous loans, she was able to make progress and increase her production. Nowadays, she makes pillows, as this generates a higher profit. Since demand for her pillows is increasing, Estela is asking for a $200 loan, in order to buy fabrics in bulk, obtaining important discounts which will help increase her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Estela es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su marido, Fredy A. de 38 años, es empleado en una fábrica. Viven todos juntos en una casa en el centro de la ciudad. Como el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente para abastecer a la familia, ella decidió hacer manualidades para vender; gracias a préstamos anteriores pudo ir progresando y ampliando su producción. Hoy día, ella confecciona almohadas, ya que esto le genera mayores ingresos. En vista de que la demanda de sus almohadas va en aumento, Estela desea un crédito de $200, con los que podrá comprar telas al por mayor, obteniendo así importantes descuentos que ayudarán a aumentar significativamente su margen de ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Goncha

texts.en: Goncha is 46 years old and lives in Yenikand village with her husband and two children. She has run her own farm for the past 7 years.  Goncha has requested a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Evangelista U. is 53 years old, married and has three children and four grandchildren.

She comes from a very poor family, and for the last 35 years has made a living traveling around the country selling clothing while her husband worked in construction. It is not easy to make a living doing this kind of work, but she and her husband have been able to give all of their children a good education because they work so hard.

For some time now, Evangelina has dreamed of opening her own store, selling clothing to the people of her community. She as come to us for a loan that will this dream possible by allowing her to buy the goods she needs to open her store --- items such as trousers, shorts and clothing used by the farmers and other people who live in her area.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her hew clothing store

loans.name: K,dominique

texts.fr:
Born on August 8, 1974 in Gapé (Zio Province, Togo), Mr. Dominique K. A. is married and has two children as well as caring for his mother who lives with them. A trained auto mechanic, he is not financially able to open his own repair workshop. After obtaining his driver's licence, he went into providing transport, a business which was bringing in a bit of income. Unfortunately, his vehicle is presently broken down and has had to be abandoned, which caused Mr. A. to try and repair an old motorcycle to use as a motorcycle taxi. This has also not been successful so far since the engine of the motorcycle is in very poor condition. In fact, the A. family is presently without an income source and in dire straits.

In order to remedy this situation, Mr. A. is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to purchase a new motorcycle which should guarantee the future of his little family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 08 Août 1974 à Gapé (P/Zio), Monsieur A. K. Dominique est marié et père de deux (2) enfants et à sa charge sa mère. Mécanicien auto de profession, il n’a pas les moyens pour ouvrir un atelier pour exercer son métier. Il s’est lancé dans le service transport après son permis de conduire, activité qui lui procurait le peu de revenu. Malheureusement le véhicule est actuellement en panne et abandonné ce qui a amené Monsieur A. à récupérer une vielle moto pour en faire taxi moto. Là aussi les choses ne tournent pas bien pour lui à cause de l’état de l’engin. Privé ainsi de tout revenu, la famille A. vit actuellement une situation très dure.

Décidé à changer cette situation, il sollicite un financement de $800 pour acheter une nouvelle moto et garantir l’avenir de sa petite famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of a motorcycle taxi

Achat de taxi moto
